I know this is a serious side effect and am waiting for some advise from my Dr. Make sure you read all the information that comes with this medication before using it.

The doctor prescribed this for my 5yr old son fro his chronic eczema, at first it looked like it was working, but then it started to get worse than it was and he started to get headaches and sore throats. he has also been complaining of stomach aches and pains. I am now taking him off and hoping that only after 2 weeks of taking this we will not see any lasting problems.

My teenage son uses this only on flare ups and it clears it after just a few days. I only use it once a day before bed and he hasn't had any side effects. I am afraid to use it on his face though, but some of your review state that it's ok?? I didn't think you were suppose to put a steroid on your face.
I have not had any positive results from using this medicine.

This is the only cream that healed my sons eczema extremely dry, scaly eyelids by the 2-3 application completely healed, for the body the ointment which does not come in cream held in the heat and made my son writhe from itching because his skin was also so irritated and open. I love that it is not a steroid and will continue its use on his body when his skin is more calm from inflammation---figures made in Japan!

My dermatologist prescribed Protopic for a psoriasis related rash on my face. The only thing that seemed to help before was a strong steroid, but steroids are bad for your skin, especially if used for more than a few days at a time. Protopic is obviously expensive because my copay was $65. The Protopic started off slowly. The steroid would give noticeable results after 1 application. The Protopic took about 2 days before I noticed a significant difference. By the 3rd day, I realized theProtopic was really working well. I am very happy with this medicine. It works better than the steroids without the side effects, and the effect seems to last longer. I can get by with one application every couple of days now. The rash on my face was embarrassing, an now it is under control.
My eyes crust up in the morning; I have very dry eyelids and dry skin on my face. I was given this ointment to soften my skin on eyelids and face.

I have had severe eczema since birth and have spent my life using cortisone creams and over the last 6 years immune suppressant drugs such as Azathioprine and Cyclosporin. After one application of Protopic my skin was completely clear. To me, this drug is amazing, yes it does burn but if you can leave it on for at least 5 hours and then shower it off you should see dramatic improvement the following day. Good luck fellow sufferers.

After unsuccessfully trying several different prescription meds for Rosacea my doctor recommended Protopic. It has been significantly more effective than anything I've used so far. Redness has been reduced and dry,scaly, bumpy skin has been almost eliminated. It occasionally causes a very mild burning sensation, but no real discomfort. After about one year of daily usage I have not had any signs of harmful side effects.
I used it on my face twice a day for a few days and the dermatitis was completely gone and hasn't come back since. Not strong enough medication for my elbows.

Using to treat LSA. Now feels worse than before I started. Side effevcts are burning and itching. I now feel raw also. Trying to last the six weeks doctor said to use it, but am now quitting after 5 weeks. Also worried about the possibility of cancer, since I-am a breast cancer survivor.

I had some chaffing on my genitals due to a reaction to a lubricant. My doctor prescribed Protopic and game me a sample. I was driving between cities and 1 hour after application it was starting to burn and itch. I stopped at a gas station and wiped it off with soapy water, but for the next 90 minutes, before I could get home to shower, it was the worst itch I'd ever had and in the most sensitive area on my body. I gave it another try two weeks later thinking I had been too raw, but it happened again and I jumped in the shower. I will NEVER use this stuff on my body again.

I have had Psoriasis in my groin for over 15 years. At first it was treated as a fungal infection with no benefit. Then went to a skin Doctor who with out hesitation said Psoriasis. Prescribed Protopic 0.1% ointment. Relief came within a few days. Dr. suggested trying it for 2-3 weeks daily to see if we could eliminate it for good, this didn't work. I still need to use this every 2-3 weeks for 2-3 days in a row. I have been doing this now for 12-13 years with no side effects. The burning and swelling go down within 3-4 hours of application. This has been a very good product for me.
It has been somewhat ineffective in treating my rash.
No side effects. I use it maybe once a week where skin erupts. I find it very effective with only 2-3 applications to "trouble spots."

I have had severe atopic dermatitis for many years. I have visited many dermatologists and they gave me hydrocortisone creams which barely help temporarily. Finally went to a allergist specialist and she took the initiative to fix the problem. I am currently taking a very high doseage prednesone, hydroxyine, and putting the Protopic on affected areas. Unfortunately the ''affected areas'' are my entire body and the bottle of protobic ointment is gone after two days. I do not understand how they can recommend me to use the ointment twice a day when it covers my entire body because I already need my last refill, and at $300 a bottle it is ridiculous.. The protopic does work for my flare ups and I'd say 80% of my body has healed almost completely. Unfortuneately I do know that with ointments like this the flare ups will come back with a vengeance, but it such an amazing feeling to have this relief and to actually see my skin cleared after such a painful and mentally draining condition that this is. I will continue to see the doctor and maybe the prednesone will help, or something else will in the long run. Thank you Protopic for my relief! Best ointment I have tried in years.

I have had alopecia areata for the last two years which has been treated with monthly corticosteriod injections. I started using Protopic approximately 2 months ago as a supplement to the injections. Within 2 weeks I started seeing an improvement in my hair regrowth and will definitely continue trying this product.
Makes the inflammation worse. It just gets red and then the redness takes forever to go away. It doesn't actually do anything!

Presumably, this is supposed to take down redness, aggravating it only temporarily. I have recurring rosacea on one of my cheeks and I am using Protopic on that; however, I used it this morning, and the redness still has not gone down. I would NOT recommend this waste of money!
takes down swelling a little

I was perscribed this about 3 months ago for Vitaligo, my skin had started to loose its colour in blotches a few years back and gradually got worse until the point it had covered all my fingers and was going up my hands, patches around my mouth, elbows, feet and the odd bit here or there... I went to the docs as it was starting to really bother me, as i tan really easy yet these parts remain a pale white. Ive started to use protopic, and have photographed results, and it actually seems to be working, the colour is starting to blotch back out, admitedly its still there after 3-4 months use but it is noticably better. I will continue to use it. I dont seem to have any side effects, i hope i see more positive results, even if it will take months.. Im going on holiday next month soon, so we will see how it stands up against a bit of sun tanning the area, but i dont think i will use it in direct sun light.

Worse medication I have ever used. Doctor gave me samples of this for dermatitis and told me to use it on my eyebrows, eyelids,around my nose, upper lip and a thin layer on the lips. Didn't put two and two together until after 4 days of use that the dry mouth, nose, burning face, lips, plus swelling of my bottom lip use due to the medication. Never again will this be used by me and now I have to reap the consequences of these side effects because I cannot take allergy medications or cortisone.I am drinking as much water as possible to wash it out of my system and praying that my thoart does not close up.

It works relatively well and it took about a week for the eczema to get better. My eczema wouldn't go away after many treatment rounds with other medicines. This has been the only thing that has worked for me. The only down part is that it really doesn't absorb into the skin quickly leaving the ointment to leave residue on many things.

I have atopic dermatitis and i have had it since i was born. i used protopic many times and i hated to put it on because it would burn so bad i would start crying. i used it on and off for many years i used this ointment from 4 years old until i was 9 years old. i really did not see a difference in my skin when i used it except for the burning. i have been on many medications because of my atopic dermatitis and i have outgrown most of it, i still have afew outbreaks once in a while but when thathappens i take prednisone, and hydrocortisone creams.

I was prescribed Protopic .1% a few months ago, it worked great for 2-3 weeks (with minimal burning) and kept my flareup under control. Sadly the beneficiary effect seems to have tapered off and my eczema is worse. =/

I was put on protopic when i was 13 years old it tells you to put on after a shower. I followed the instructions and ended up screaming my head off because of the burning that it caused. It did work for a total of two days then my eczema spread everywhere from head to toe. It made everything worse instead of helping me with my issue.

I have had dermatitis since I was six months old and have tried many, many prescription and otc drugs for it. Protopic by FAR works the best and the fastest. Within a couple of days no itching or redness or flaking. Also works well on my four year old son who has the same thing.

I started to get very chapped lips that would not go away. The chapped lips turn into to swollen,burning,blistering,peeling,bright red painful lips. I was apparently allergic to some food that I was unaware of. At first I thought it was nothing and would go away which it did but came back in full force. I had to see a doc for this. My lips looked disgusting and were very painful and I had not a clue to what I was eating to cause this. My doctor had me try Protopic and gave me an inj of celestone. I was 70% better within 24 hrs or less.! By the third day - my lips looked actually normal. The swelling went down immediately and blisters and peeling as well. I read the cancer dangers involved with this drug and I was very concerned with that but I won't be using this for more than 2 weeks so I should be safe. Just to let anyone know that it worked like a dream for me and I am so thankful that my lips are back to normal.
This has been prescribed by my dermatologist to treat my lichen planus. It is helping, but I am aware of the fact that it can cause cancer, so I will limit how often I use it.

been using on and off for several years now.helped some in the begining.Does not help with itching at the time, better results daily use, up to two weeks at a time then i try to stay away from it for awhile. Skin tends to thin in area of use (hands.)
I have just received my perscription 3 days ago. so far the itch has begun to weaken.
My son got cancer from this drug. He was put on it when he was 6 months old. Yes, it cleared his eczema, but in return he got melanoma. It destroys your immune system.

I have always been sensitive on my right hand and have had periods of outbreaks on my ring and middle finger for years, but was easily treated with cortisone type creams. During my last pregnancy I became hyper sensitive to almost anything (even water) that touched my skin and nothing worked at all. The condition got so bad that I could not open my hands or fingers and they were covered with deep lesions. My doctor had prescribed 7 types of creams and cortisone treatments - finally I INSISTEDI see a specialist who prescribed Aerius along with a mild cortisone (used evening ONLY on clean dry skin) and Protopic. i was leery as the side affects noted types of cancer being reported, but I was in sooo much pain. The next day the fissures and lesions that had created scars on my hands were closed and were beginning to heal. Day 2 the skin started to regain pigmentation, OMG it works!!!! I tried everything, and was in tears whenever I went to the doctor about this as a mother of 2 young boys I could not even hardly pick them up without cracking my hands open - if you need less than a pea sized amount and its gone in 2 days and you don't need it for months - isn't it worth having clear skin without pain and risk of infections????
I spent over a month using a drug described by my family DR with no results. I went to a dermatologist who described Protopic and in 48 hours the dermatitis was gone. Great drug.
I had atopic dermatitis on my eyelid with one treatment it went away. No more swelling or itching or embarrassing questions about eye being swollen

after 22 different treatments failed, Protopic was prescribed as a last resort. Burned like my skin was literally on fire, which was the condition I was trying to treat in the first place (extreme vag. itch/burn for 16 months IN A ROW!!) Eventually diagnosed as being an allergic reaction to something either injested or externally. Protopic could not be washed off & the firey burning lasted for 3 days afterward. Possibly I may be allergic to this drug (?) It was extremely severe-I did not leavethe house for days after using this product.

I have atopic dermatitis since 7 years ago.Initially, it had been wrongly diagnosed as neurodermatitis,and I was using many types of steroid medine for the fisrt 4 years until their curing effects became less and less.After a two year break, I start to use protopic from December 2007 ntil now,October 2008 as I was diagnosed to have atopic dermatitis at the end of last year .I apply this ointment only when the symptome appears and try to apply protopic only on the affected skin(the whole neck including the upper chest and back part connecting to the neck, though it would inevitably cover some part of the surrounding healthy skin) I apply to those area once daily and ususally for 6 consecutive days at night before sleep.Severe side effects such as serious itch and burning feeling of the applied area always occurs at the 1st,2nd,3rd day of use and will disappear from the fourth day with the improvement of the dermatitis symptom.I have to take medicine like Centrizine to relieve these side effects for the first 2 days.I try to minimise the use of the drug by reducing the usage time to once a day and repeat this 6-day cycle every 10~14days knowing the medicine is probably linked to cancers.So far I have finished using 5 tubes of 10g(0.1%) in a year time. The medicine is effective in relieving the AD symptom but I am also worried about the side effects including burning/itchy feeeling,links to cancer and depression(in my case),esp. after reading many articles regaring the links of this drug to cancers.I've decided to discontinue the drug when I finish this 1-year treatment and to go for a thorough medical checkup to see whether I am at a higher risk to get cancers afterall, though I know there may be no better treatment for my skin condition yet.
My 3 yr old son starting using this when he was about 2. Nothing else would work and his eczema was horrible. I only use it when he breaks out bad, and it does help almost completly clear his skin.
Protopic clears up my excema flare ups. I can apply makeup over it, and not worry about the interaction. I only use it when I have the flare ups, and it works!
Prescribed for severe cosmetic Nickel allergy. Did not help one bit. Had to switch to Cutivate.
I used this medicine for 1 week. My face was better for about a week and then it came back so I am using it again. It makes you feel very hot. Do not use and drink!

Initially turned off by the "sting" after applying to eyelids and nose. After a few days the sting disappeared. After about 10 days of use I began to notice significant improvement. After a month my facial eczema has completely cleared. I now use once daily. Grateful to have a non-steroid ointment that works.
My daughterâ??s itching skin got worse after using this. I think I need to switch back to steroids. Disappointed.
This made my child's ezcema noticeably worse (more red and aggravated) as soon as we put it on. I then saw that one of the side effects is it MAKING EZCEMA WORSE?! WTF

If I could give this medication a negative number, I would. I stuck with it for 3 weeks for my mild/moderate eczema. It made my skin MUCH WORSE. I now have severe eczema up my arms, on my face and neck and it's still spreading. Swelling, weeping, cracking skin that is bright red and itchy/painful. DON'T USE EUCRISA

I have been suffering from hand eczema, particularly on my fingers, for years. I have tried just about every OTC creams (colloidal oatmeal) moisturizers, etc., powerful steroids such as clobetasol propionate (multiple side effects) for very little and very temporary relief. Iâ??ve used wheelbarrow loads of bandaids because of the thin skin and the cracks and bleeding on my fingers.
 
 My dermatologist gave me some samples of Eucrisa. A week later, for the first time in years, my wounds are healedwithout bandaids and the eczema is nearly gone. Eucrisa is enormously expensive but is worth it. I know it wonâ??t always have the same result for everyone but for me it is nothing short of a miracle!

My daughter had a mild reaction to Eucrisa. Instead of it helping you treat her eczema it actually made it worse. The day after we applied Eucrisa, she had a rash the size of the treatment surface. The rash had since healed, however now my daughter's skin is discolored in those areas (similar to how your skin looks after a flare first heals). I'm very disappointed in this medicine. We have discontinued use.
This product has helped my 11 year old daughter's eczema tremendously and quickly.
My eczema was so bad on my fingers, I was embarresed to show them even to my doctor. After using eucrisa 3 times the eczema was completely gone, my fingers were healed up and looked normal again.
The eczema was so bad on my fingers I was embarrassed to even show them to my doctor. After only 3 applications of eucrisa my fingers were completely healed up and looked normal again.

I have been using Eucrisa for almost 2 weeks and although it's slow to completely remove the dry areas on my hand it has been the only thing to have made such a significant change. I am very pleased with this product. It has stopped the itch and there is immediate relief. It feels very good on the skin after applied. My dry spots I've had for years in the same spot after trying multiple steroid creams that did not remove it are almost non-existent with Eucrisa.
I have been using this medication for about 3 months to treat eczema & it hasn't helped at all.

My eczema varies from mild to severe in various places on my body. I have what I would call "moderate" eczema on the crease of my arm and after using Eucrisa on that spot for 7 days I see very little difference. The severe spots of eczema behind my knees were totally unaffected by the medication. The mild spots on my face (eye lid & forehead) have gone away slightly but not completely so that did help some with the facial eczema. I am not sure if this stuff is suitable for very young children orwhat but after spending $40 and seeing basically no difference I would NOT recommend this medication. I had very high hopes for this but unfortunately it did not work well on my eczema.
Eucrisa definitely helped my eczema. It also seems a little safer than the steroid creams I have been using. However, after 8 days of applying twice a day it has not eliminated my flare.
Only had it 6 days, seems to be improving my eczema. Really burns when applied, using it on my face.

This medication did help to lower my A1C, but for 10 months that I was on this drug, I kept having severe upper respiratory issues. Throat, chest, nasal passage way itched severely (from inside). The amount of mucous that was coming from my body was unbelievable. It took me this long to figure out what was wrong with me. I stopped taking this drug less than a week ago. I'm on my forth round of antibiotics and Prednisone in the last few months. I literally felt like I was dying, loss a ton of sleep from coughing severely all night and day. Worst experience ever with a drug. I am starting to feel a little better since DC this drug.

I wrote already but didnt find here so Iam writing again.
 It s such a worst medicine that any medicine is supposed to treat the disease.
 But my diabetes levels increased instead of reducing

This is the worst medicine I have taken in my life. Sugar level increased drastically within 4 days of starting and side effects made me sick.

been on this med for almost a year. seem to work okay. blood sugars have been in range most of the time, occasionally I have high readings. have to watch what I eat, make sure I have protein and watch my carbs

I'm 75, weigh 138, 5'10", A1C 6.2 - 6.7 with 2mg Glimepiride + 2000mg metformin. Dr switched me to Januvia 100mg + 2000mg metformin. Blood sugar went out of control from day 1. Over 200 daily average (I test 7 times/day). Morning Fasting went from 115 to 226. Nine fhours of vomiting and diarhhea on second day. Nauseous every day for two weeks. Lost 5 lbs in two weeks--I need to gain weight. Stopped after day 14. Very bad drug for me. Dr now wants me to try another miracle drug: Farxiga. Don't think so as I will need a loan from Warren Buffet to buy it.
It has stopped me from having the highs and lows from my diabetes.

I have been taking 2000 mg metforming for 9 years when it started not working well,, initial A1C 9.4 went to 7 with metformin. after year 9 it went above 7 and slowly creeped toward 8, I started 25 mg Januvia 2 years ago adn it worked immediatly with the metformin to bring my A1C down from 7.8 to 6.4 and I lost 4 lbs. my doctor added a Blood pressure pill at that time also 2 years ago since my kidney function started to show signs of failure. Now at 1.1 they are marginal and he wants me off the metformin. He prescribed the Jardian to replace the metformin. But the Jardian is bad for my kidneys according to the data sheet it's worst than the metformin. I'm going to see a kidney doctor before I start that but I like the Januvia and the junuvia site has coupons for 12 months from $100/90 days to $5/90 days ,, so use the vendors coupons they are the best. And don't overmedicate the Januvia, my doctor wanted to start me on 50 mg,, but I wanted 25 lowest dose and it's working fine.

I have been taking 100mg of Januvia a day for a little over a month now. Since day one, I have had severe diarrhea up to 17 times a day, mostly bile. The side effects are no joke. I have had severe headaches, joint pain, abnormal heart beat, severe abdominal pain, my energy is completely wiped out, irritability, uneasy sleep, vomiting. It's the worst drug I have ever used. I have been beyond miserable. I have just today decided to not take Januvia and suddenly my diarrhea has slowed down, my headache is going away, my joints are still aching, but it is easing as well. I only took this medication because my NP convinced me it's safe. I didn't trust it and from now on, considering the outcome, I will listen to my instincts. I am close to pancreatitis, so I am now fasting for two days, and will be on a liquid diet for nearly a week. So not worth it. I have never in my life been so sick.
side effects: Headache, Joint Pain, Abdominal Pain, Irrelgular Heartbeat, Insomnia, Vomiting
side effects cleaned: Headache, Body Pain, Abdominal Pain, Irrelgular Heartbeat, Insomnia, Vomiting

drug_review: Side effects experienced with januvia: Extreme tachycardia, trouble breathing, chest pressure and chest feeling heavy. Face pressure. Feeling like someone was choking me. Swelling feet, ankles and legs. Numbing & tingling in right arm and thrifty jaw. Nausea. Chest fluid. Feeling like I was going to have a heart attack. Horrible non stop fast and slow heartbeats and skipping or adding beats. Made me exhausted and sick feeling for weeks. Additional Comments about januvia: Didnâ??t know this had ablack box warning and could cause heart failure. I hope thereâ??s no lasting damage done to my heart. Terrible medication. I was going into heart failure. Stopped it today and no more tachycardia or chest pain. Fluid in my lungs as flem is coughing up. Dangerous medication !!!
side effects: Tachycardia, Breathlessness, Chest Pressure, Swollen Feet, Swollen Ankles, Swollen Legs, Tingling, Nausea, Fatigue

drug_review: Been taking this 1 time a day for a couple years along with Metformin 2 x day. It did bring my daily blood test down; however my monthly cost went from $0 to $123 with the donut hole. I couldn't afford it when it first went up and my blood count went way up (in 300-400 range). I am going to see a new endroconologist in 10 days. My last A1C was 13.7 and my NP put me on insulin right away. Insulin had been advised on my last visit several months ago, but I refused. I have gotten extremely forgetful in the past few years and don't know if it is the januvia (only new med besides 2 months on insulin) or family history. My gram, mom and aunt all had dementia.
My only negative side effects have been extreme constipation which may be enough to stop. Iâ??m only on 25mg but it started after taking.

I took this drug for one month. Each week I became more and more forgetful and my ability to reason was gone. By the fourth week I was presenting with stroke like symptoms. My husband took me to the emergency room where I was immediately admitted. I was taken off this drug and within a few days, all symptoms were gone.

Just 2 weeks ago, endocrinologist recommended to take in morning; glympermide and 500 Metformin in evening. I'm a delayed reaction person: took 2 weeks before my body hit the wall. Severe muscular and spinal pain, (I have other health problems not related to Type 2) plus hips felt like i was drop-kicked by a donkey. Overall symptoms in my joints as if i had a flu. I'm done. Don't need someone ruining my life. MY new normal blood sugar WILL be 160-250. Because i say so. This is ridiculous with the pills being pushed. My A1c went down to 6 on Metformin 2x a day, morn and evening. (reduced Met because of severe diarrhea: NOW i'm severely constipated on Januvia!) I changed ALL my eating habits and lost 20 lbs. My next goal is the exercise, so I'm sure the blood sugar will be leveled out a little more. And if it DOESN'T, I'm fine with that: will just keep making better food choices and do the best i can with my own circumstances. As far as I'm concerned, what's going on out here on this continent is "Medical Vampirism": the health industry sticks its fangs into your neck and drains your blood and your money till you are dead. Just sayin.......
no side effects so far taking this medication

My a1c was 9.6, I had taken 100mg. for 3 months. Its 6.1 after taking half pill for the next 3 months it went to 5.1. No side effects so far. I walk 1.25 miles daily and try my best to have a 60 carb or less intake. Having had Sepsis shock two and a half years ago. I have to keep a close eye on kidneys do to the loss of 50%. But numbers are looking good. Thank God!

After 2 weeks I developed severe case of dysentery diarreah went through 30 pairs of underwear overnight could not stop crapping in my underwear in bed at night woke up vomiting dry heaves, dizzy, sweating shortness of breath, too weak to go to ER I called an ambulance and received an IV drip with morphine to stop the severe pain of stomach cramps which incapacitated me. Spent 2 days in the hospital. Felt like I had a heart attack. I almost died. The diarreah dehydrated me left me weak as a kitten for weeks.
side effects cleaned: Diarrhea, Vomiting, Dizziness, Shortness of Breath , Weakness

drug_review: I was taking Janumet (Januvia Metfomin 50-500 mg)twice a day more than 4 years. Initially, my A1C1 was 10.8 and less than one year with this medicine, food control and light exercises my A1C1 dropped close to 6. Past 3-4 years my A1C1 was 6.1 to 6.3. In December 2017 my insurance stopped paying for Janumet. Now I am taking 100 mg of Januvia once a day and Metformin 500 mg twice a day. This is really not working. With food control and exercises my A1C1 is now more than 7 and fasting blood sugar is always more than 160. I am trying to get my old medicine again. I recommend Janumet but not Januvia.

This drug almost killed me! My entire body was numb and tingling for 3 months. I was in ER twice, admitted once ,had thousands of dollars in test and I am happy they were all normal. Once I stopped the drug it took 3 months for the symptom's to stop and co away! I did report this to the drug company.

I started out on metaformin once a day, then went to twice a day, levels and A1C started going up again, then add Januvia seemed to help at first then I stared gaining weight and sugar levels and A1C started going up again, added trilicity shots once a week seemed to be doing ok, now the levels and A1C are climbing again. I stopped the Januvia because of the joint pain I was having and the sugar cravings. Been off it about a month and my levels are not any better so heading to the DR again to see what to try next. I think diabetes drugs are a joke the are not made to help for a long time before you have to add another pill or shot to keep things working. Big pharm making some money off from these for sure.
I have been on this medicine for 2 weeks, since Metformin stopped working. I am experience anxiety and also sleeplessness. I don't really see a change in my sugar numbers at all.

I started Januvia 100 mg twice a day with Metformin 1000mg. It worked great at first, and brought my sugar levels down, Then I started developing severe lower stomach pain, and was treated for Diverticulitis, which I believe the Januvia caused. During this time my sugar levels started going up, it was like the Januvia just quit working. I was switched to another Medication, but a year later was put back on Januvia, this time I immediately gain 5 pounds after starting it, and have been experiencing swelling and tightness in my hands
I have taken januvia for two weeks.cannot give proper answer

Could not take metformin at all, did not agree with me, even the XR. Started on Levemir then DR added Januvia. Taking for almost two months now and have found my A1c coming down and blood sugar readings improving. Only side effects I have noticed is runny nose and some stomach discomfort that has gradually decreased. Runny nose could be from post virus that I got so will see if that goes away as well.So far this is working for me.I have joint pain but cannot pinpoint if it is from this drug, statins or just old age!

Couldn't take metformin due to diarrhea and stomach upset. Started Junuvia and it seemed to be working great, my A1C went down. Then I got something similar to psoriasis, swelling of legs and feet, severe fatigue, pain in the feet and legs, back ache constantly, weakness, more things than I can say has happened. My A1C elevated, sugar will not go down below 140 usually a lot higher. Can't see that it is helping at all now, will discuss with dr going off this medicine. All over feel bad, would rather take shots and feel better than this.

Unfortunately, I have seen no change in my A1C (still at 8.2) and fastings have increased to 140-170. My doctor is going to try Invokana next.

drug_review: My A1C 7.2 to 8.4 taking Januvia, I did better taking Metformin

Been taking Metformin 850's twice a day for about 3 1/2 years now. My glucose has been getting more difficult to manage with diet and exercise. My previous A1c was 6.6. Now it's 7.3. I was surprised it rose so much. Just started Januvia 50mg 1x/day. Only been on for 5 days and already I see results in my daily readings. I am hopeful I don't get any of the side effects mentioned in many of the previous postings. I will follow up in about 30 days.

Started Januvia 2 weeks ago and immediately started experiencing migraines that woke me up 2 to 3 hours earlier than my normal wake-up time, causing me to struggle thru my workday highly fatigued. I've been on metformin 500 mg 2 x daily with no side effects. Januvia has NOT improved my mg/dl numbers. Plan to discuss discontinuation of Januvia and possibly increasing daily metformin dose w/ my Doc.

I started using Januvia 100mg with Metformin 500 mg 2xs a day about 2 weeks ago. My numbers have never gone below 149 and I have severe joint pain. The pain is in a knee that I was already having some issues with, but this exacerbated the issue. I didn't realize until all that time that it could have been a side effect. I am stopping it immediately and will follow up with results.
It worked good for the first two weeks then I started itching constantly. I stopped taking the meds and the itching went away.

I have noticed my stomach area feeling sore and my hair changing since I have been on this medicine for 3 months. I rather use my Metformin 1000mg because it flushes me out more than this medicine. I didn't like it.

Abdominal pain nausea. My globular filtration rate went from 82 to 44 after two months. A second test a month later and it was 44. He has not yet retested for protein in my urine, but there is now foam in my urine.

Januvia has been great for me so far. No side effects and it quickly lowered my glucose levels. The in home self testing my levels have gone from 200-300 to 132-148. Will have my A1C tested by doc next month. It was 8.0. I take 1 100mg tablet a day after dinner. Metformin was a horrible drug for me. Couldnt tolerate at all. Burning legs and arms and severe stomach issues. Stopped a few days after stopping Metformin. Heard you cant stay on Javuvia very long. Dont know why. Will have to see what doc says but ive overall been satisfied with this drug.

I was taking januvia for high blood sugar levels called pre diabetes . I have been on it for over 5 years . In the last couple of years I have been suffering with very painful ice cold hands most of the time . I went for all kind of tests with no answers . As I have had bad side effects with other drugs I thought I would skip the januvia for a time . After about two weeks off januvia my hands started feeling normal again . It has been a couple of months now without terrible hand pain . I am donewith januvia and will try to control sugar levels with diet .

first my A1C was 5.8 and I was taking Metformin only. My doctor added Januvia 50mg 2 times a day. I could not afford the drug so called drug company who offered the drug for free after meeting their requirements. My A1C is now 5.2 and with exercise I have lost10 lbs. I did have side effects such a fatigue and headaches but the symptoms lasted a short time. As soon as my A1C is stable I will discontinue the medication per my doctor. He checks my blood every three months
Good side effects: weight loss and works good as a laxative. Bad points: cost and lack of effectiveness as a glucose controlling drug

Diagnosed 2/2015 and put on insulin and Metformin. I have had issues with Metformin from day one. A1C starting was 11.7. Change of diet, exercise and added Januvia a few months after. & months in and A1C is at 6 but steady abdominal issues continue to increase. This started before Januvia. Going to see about removing or reducing Metformin. My life is hell right now. Sure my sugar levels average 85 to 110 but not worth the constant cramping and diarrhea. Jury still out here but seeing as it started with Metformin, that's where I am starting. Reading up on Berberine 500mg homeopathic (NOT a drug),for future reference.
I have been taking expensive Januvia for six months and see no results.

Within a couple of days of starting the medication, I began having headaches and upper respiratory issues. I took the drug for 2 weeks & discontinued as the side effects were becoming debilitating. Within 24-36 hours of discontinuing the drug, the side effects went away. I would not recommend this drug due to the side effects. However, it did bring my blood sugar numbers down from the low-200's to the 140's. If you can deal with the possibility of side effects, the drug is effective.
it almost sent me to ER. my heart rate went very high? Also was not effective. Dangerous stuff!

taken for one month in efforts to control out of control blood sugar levels. Muscle pain and weakness. Congested all the time. Trouble breathing. Trouble sleeping. Blurry vision. Constipation. Swelling of legs and feet. really did not lower blood sugar much. But worse than that it turned me into a zombie, unable to work,, just went back to bed .

drug_review: My dr put me on this med to help me loose weight. My appetite has been raging for a long time. He put me on this med to help me control both my BS & my appetite. I'm NOT hungry any more. BUT my BS level is up.I did have a regular fasting level 110-135, now it's 150-170. I've been on it for 2 months. Extreme bad winter weather has made me a shut in for the last 3 months. Hopefully soon I'll be able to get outside & walk. I'll stay on it till I see my dr in 2 months. Surely it will start bringingdown my BS level. My dr said if I loose weight, I have a good chance of getting off of all diabetic medicines. I've tried to read & learn all I can. This med does have a lot of warnings of bad side effects of which I've not had any signs of yet. I just don't understand why it won't lower my BS level a lot more. I'm only eating about 1800 calories a day. I carb count too.

My prescription drug insurance increased my co-pay from $35 per month to $88 per month. this equates $1.16 per tablet (one per day) to $2.93 per day. the insurance's cost did not change. This medication is well over priced and not in my best interest to pay 90 days $264......I will discontinue it use.

I have just started taking Januvia, at the lowest possible dose. Within 2 days of starting, I've experienced severe dizziness, headaches, painful glands in my neck (under my jaw) and pain/tenderness in the upper chest area, as well as in my upper back (between shoulder blades) and lower back. I had tried Metformin before this, but the stomach issues and diarrhea were too difficult to manage. I had high hopes that Januvia would work for me, but after the way it's started out...I don't know what to think now. Has anyone here experienced the body pain and/or the painful swollen glands like I have? I'd love to hear about it. Thanks and best wishes for improved health to all of you! Pamela (in Victoria, BC Canada)

I would get Nausea too every time I took the pill. I am going to Dr sometime next week to get a medication other than Januvia, as It did not work-out well for me.

I've been on Januvia for two years. It hasn't helped blood sugar much. I'm extremely tired all the time. Saw a tv commercial that it may cause pancreatic cancer, so I stopped taking it today and I am not as tired as I have been. Feel better today than I have in the last 6 months.
Have taken Januvia for 3+ years following triple bypass surgery 4-20-09 and primary care doc feels Januvia has helped keep my diabetes in check.

I have been on januvia for 1 week. I know that's not enough time to tell if it is going to work or not, but I have been experiencing some foot, ankle and leg pain. I have also had some groin pain. I also take livalo for cholesterol problems and experience the same type of pain. Not sure if both meds are causing the pain or just one of them. only problem is it is too expensive.
easy to use

I have been on insulin for 5 years taking lispro and lantus insulin and also metfromin 1000mg twice day, my sugar levels have been up and down over the years, A1C levels from 7-12, my doctor put me on Januvia she told me it would take awhile for it to see any results two days taking it and my sugar drop to 100, 2 months on Januvia my levels have stayed there, I have stopped taking my lipro insulin and just take 40mg of lantus at night. I take 1000mg of metformin once a day now.. Januvia has change my life i dont have to carry all my pills and insulin's with me anymore.. this pill truly works, I have not had any crazy side effects, just swollen feet for about three days..

Not sure of the effectiveness/satisfaction of it yet, just started taking this about 2-3 weeks in. I've noticed when I would walk I'd get a sharp pain in my toe/ball of foot area. My legs would feel numb at times. Not sure if it could be my lounger..or slightly cramped. Not bad/sharppains or anything..just the occasional stretch would do. I had stomach cramps like in my pancreas area..it would come and go when i first started, but after taking it- I do not experience it anymore. I do experience the occasional diarrhea though when taking metformin(2,000mg a day) as well as januvia 100mg. Alot of gas/air in my stomach when I first started. I felt really bloated, but not so much anymore. I'm giving this a shot. If it benefits me and works out fine..why not. If not, doc and I will find alternative means. :-D

I havent used Januvia ...yet. My doctor prescribed it today in place of glimepiride. I also take 500mg Metformin. Based on the reviews I dont think I will take Januvia. I will continue to use cinnamon pills (caribbean antidote) and my metformin...and of course exercise and watch my diet. But at this time, I do not wantto introduce more meds into my system. drug_review: I started taking 50MG each day about a week ago after my A1C came in at 10.3. The Endo said it works very well; he was right. Still taking Metformine 1000 twice a day, but my levels are right where they should be. Be careful; your levels will drop and you need to eat with this drug at regular intervals.

i was taking acto for over 1 year,but it was causeing my eyes to have blind spots.now i take januvia an i love it!!!!!!!!!!
IUSED TO TAKE METFORMIN AND I PUT ON 25 LBS. I STOPPED TAKING IT, AND LOST THE WEIGHT IN 2 MOS. THEY WANT ME TO TRY THIS JUNUVIA. ILL GIVE IT A TRY, AND REPORT BACK. ANYTHING IS BETER THAN METFORMIN.

Prior to Januvia, I was on Advandia which made me ill and kept me with lows. Januvia controls and I have minimal lows or highs. Since starting Januvia over 3 years ago, my A1C has dropped from 7.2 to as low as 5.4 but no higher thabn 6.5%. Love it. Also, I might add that take Lantus insulin with it.

I started to take 100 mg Januvia, when my feet started to hurt and had a seering pain in my colon at night. My feet started to feel like they had a uric acid attack, and I started to feel a lot of pain if I tied my shoes too tight. I was on januvia for about 90 days. Since that time, I have not been able to get my blood sugar below 350, regardless of what I try. My feet still hurt, but they are slowly improving. I can at least tie my shoes and walk without pain, but my joints between my toes feel like they still have some uric acid crystals. The feet are very sensitive, so I have to watch what pairs of socks I need to wear. I didn't ask for januia, but a doctors recommendation. I had some surgery lately and the doctors were concerned about my fasting high blood sugar, which was 349, and after a couple shots of insulin, the blood sugar would not drop, but infact went up to 400. Even after several hours, the blood sugar only dropped to 350 +/- 10, but has consistanly been around 300-350, regardless of the medication I take now.
It has been very satifactory.

I have switched to my old treatment and I was pretty normal when I started this med. Since I took this my sugar count shot up and it hasn't come down since. It put my sugar out of whack and it has made it impossible for my sugar to return to normal.

Terrible constipation - I had to manually empty my bowel - I felt like I'd been raped everyday And this dru never lowered my BS - so there claims to have an alternative to METFORMIN Hah!!!
did not help at all

On Glumetza which is a one a day metformin 1500mg,blood sugars in 7 to 8 mmol/l (Canada) range fasting (600-700 mg/dl for USA).Started Januvia,it brought levels down to between 5 and 6 mmol/l, (430-530 mg/dl USA) Fasting. No constipation, No stomach pain, No Rash or Hives.Satisfied after month one.
best drug i have ever used for my diabetes. lowered my sugar on the first day even within 1 hours of taking the drug 100mg

Januvia does not last 24 hrs, but is only a once a day medicine. I am now taking it in the evening with my dinner. I also take Metformin and Humalog 75/25 mix at the same time. When I took it with my noon meal my day glucose readings were lower, but my fasting readings were higher. Since taking it in the evening, my results are lower (131 this am). However, after eating breakfast (bowl of shredded wheat, 1% milk, Splenda, plus 2 strips of turkey bacon, it was 235. I am monitoring how my readings are affected by when I take Januvia, but would really like to get off it. At this time it is the only medicine that has been really effective it lowering my glucose readings.
works great - 50 miligrams in am - one question. Anyone have problems with numbness in fingers? Maybe it has nothing to do with Januvia but I never had numbness before Thx

I have been on Januvia since Augusta 2010. My resting blood sugar went from the 140's to from 78 to 105 range. My AC1 dropped from 8.5 to 6.1 range. I have been on Januvia since 11/10 and I had immediate results of lower BS the next day. I went from 289 mg/dl to mid 300'smg/dl with 2000mg of Metformin, to 189mg/dl to 150's every day since. I havent had any side effects that I have noticed...if these numbers are good for the dr. on 12/06 I will continue with Januvia but if not then I will be going on daily shots...I have felt overall more even keeled on this combo of meds since being diagnosed 5 years ago.. I was very worried about side effects from reading reviews but am very relieved that I havent had any....I only have to pay $48.00 for a monthly supply, but well worth it! drug_review: I have been on this medication for a little over a month... The first two weeks my blood sugars were in the 320- 394 range. Mind you before I started Januvia I was on Metformin and Glyburide and my blood sugars were constantly in the upper 500's.. Now after a little over a month they are in the mid 100's!! I no longer have to deal with high blood sugars or horrible side effects from the Metformin.. I would definitely recommend Januvia!

After 31/2 weeks on Januvia, had almost daily severe headaches, some constipation, muscle swelling, and increased blood sugar readings of at least 40 mg/dL. This medicine needs to be withdrawn by the FDA
I have experienced severe indigestion after taking Januvia. The indigestion felt like my chest was on fire. I quit taking it before I was able to evaluate the effectiveness in lowering BS.

Well I have been on this for two weeks and it isn't doing a thing! We added Glyburide once a day in the morning and it isn't helping either. Why won't my sugar come down!! I don't want to end up taking shots! Have to call the doctor back tomorrow with my results! We'll see what she says. It is expensive but a little hint, I checked out their website and was able to get it free for 30 days to try! Also got a coupon for the next refill, if there is a next refill! Also check out Actos's website, they offer a $50.00 rebate if anyone swithes to that!

I am anxious Annie when it comes to taking medicine...I was scared to take it at first reading reviews u hear good and bad..I have realized we are all different and our bodies react differently..I have been taking this medicine for 4 months..only side effect I had was upper respirtatory symtpoms..could be the weather or medicine overall I am very grateful for this medicine my blood sugars are within normal range and I no longer am afraid of low blood sugars which I experienced with Byetta.Some people have said they have read about pancreatitis but I think all the meds relating to DM can cause it..since your liver and pancreas work together... U never know until U try.. Good luck everyone hope it works for u

drug_review: Januvia has helped control my blood glucose levels pre and post-prandial. I have not had any prolbem with hypoglycemia and do not need insulin.

I was on 100 mgs of Januvia. My sugars stayed high, I felt really bad, no sleep, I finally stopped eating. ( I never felt hungry and food made me sick.) My Dr accused me of not taking it, cause my A1C's were at 12. I took the darn things, they didn't work at all.
This drug has been working for me. However it is very expensive,even with insurance deductable I can not afford it. Looking for a drug with same effectiveness

So far, Januvia has helped me loose 20 lbs and I feel great and have been working out.I am using it in conjunction with 2000 mg of Metformin a day. I go to my doctor for my 3 month A1C test so I will see if it is helping. So far good on my end:)

Been on this medicine for 3 months, severe constipation, stomach bloating and some leg pain but I also take Zetia which has the same effect alone. The #'s were higher while on the pill and just overall felt uncomfortable. Stopped taking all meds and will watch my diet and exercise to try and keep the #'s down. That has to be better than feeling like that. No BM for days and that is after talking all kinds of pills to help.
ITS BETTER THAN HAING TO WORRY ABOUT GOING TO LOW.
possible hematuria after beginnning this medicine.

After one week of Januvia, my seasonal sinusitis progressed rapidly to complete nasal obstruction, pansinusitis and shortness of breath at rest. Vision clouded and progressed to retinal bleeding after a coughing spell. Blindness corrected by surgically draining bloody fluid from each eye. This was a bad trip but better than death by pancreatic or kidney failure.
side effects cleaned: Sinusitus, Shortness of Breath , Blurry Vision, Hematuria

drug_review: Have been taking this medication for about one month. It seems to be working. I feel more energy and my eyesight has improved. I was also taking Actoplus+met (with metformin). This was a bad combination. The metformin drug was too much and caused some swelling and hard for me to breathe, restless at night. I discontinued the Actoplus+met and Januvia medication has made a bigger impact on my numbers. I was reading about 200, now reading about 150 on glucose monitor. Think the longer I use, the better it will be (also include more frequent exercise and better eating habits--I am working more on this.)
I was very pleased with the effect Januvia had on my type 2 diabetes. However, my doctor changed my oral diabetes medication & now my #'s have gone up. Hoping to return to Januvia.

Well, this is my follow up review of Januvia. I went to my doctor on 8/18/09 because my respiratory problems had gotten worse. I could not rest, day or night, because this medicine had caused a respiratory infection with wheezing. I told my doctor and the doctor acknowledged that this was one of the side effects of Januvia. I was placed on antibiotics and given a cough medicine. I am still having breathing with wheezing. I have never had asthma or any symptoms before my staring Januvia. I was told by doctor to stop taking Januvia. But I told the doctor I took myself off of this medication about 9 days before coming in to see doctor. I'm afraid that the side effects are not going away soon. My body feels better since getting off, but still have some wheezing and coughs.
Still don't know enough to rate it. I only started Januvia about a week ago and my readings are quite high. 12.9 and 9.2 on a good diet. Does it take a bit of time to kick in? or should I give up???

Januvia, lowered blood sugar readings with in normal range (less than a 100) also take Metformin 5/500mg twice a day (2 pills) since taking Januvia noted tiredness, contipation, slight headaches, itching, less sleep and sinus issues at night. Other than that Januvia works for me. Only been taking 2 weeks. Will make a months use my validation point to determine next steps.
side effects: Fatigue, Headache, Constipation, Itching, Sinusitis, Insomnia
side effects cleaned: Fatigue, Headache, Constipation, Itching, Sinusitis, Insomnia

drug_review: Blood sugar levels decreased.

I have been taking 100mg for 2 months and I have experienced joint pains, body aches, headaches, constipation. I have been having serious breathing and respiratory problems with congestion. This medicine has made my life miserable. I feel worst taking it now. My daily activities have been sluggish and depressing. I am going to stop taking this medication because I think it is causing my body more physical problems than the manufacturer wants you to know. I have had serious constipation with stomach bloathing since I started this medication. My glucose levels really haven't changed that much. I am going back to my regular medicines, glipizide and methformin. I think there should be more indepth research done on Januvia. It has been too costly financially and to my general health. My heart beats very fast and I feel so tired all the time. Very disappointed and I hope there have not been permanent side effect damages to me.

I was on insulin 2 x daily. I began taking 1000 megs of Cinnamon daily. After four months, my Doctor took me off insulin. I then began taking Januniva 100 Meg 1 x Daily. With insulin, my readings were still in the 150 range. With Cinnamon and Januniva, my readings run from 75 to 110. I am very pleased and feel great.
My glucometer reading have gone from in the 200`s to low 100`s--feel very tired and severe flushing feeling at times--2-3 bm`s a day
I HAVEN'T TAKEN THIS MEDICATION. I WILL BE STARTING MY PRESCRIPTION ON 08-06-2009. JUST GATHERING INFORMATION ABOUT THIS DRUG BEFORE I START TAKING IT.
For the time being januniva has kept my blood sugars level.It took over a year to convince the insurance co to pay for it.
Effectiveness This drug has worked fine for me. The problem is that it too expensive to use about $178.00 for 30 pills.

I have been having a dry throat & my feet,knees & legs are in alot of pain.Now I can't believe all this pain is coming from my pinched nerve in my back !Tired all the time & no get up & go & very depressed !
dose not seem to work.blood sugar still high most of time.
i love it and it helps

Lowered my blood sugar. Leg Pain severe, ankle and knee joint stiffness muscles hurt to stand.

I was prescribed metformin and avandia 5 years ago. Now have kidney disease in stage 3 with filtering of the kidney at level 41. Metformin and Avandia caused this problem. Was then put on Actos 30 Mg. daily and Novalog 70/30 flex pin. Actos has made my weight go up and now I have swelling in my feet and legs. A few weeks ago the doctor decreased the Actos to 15 mg. and added Januvia 100 Mg. daily. The dr also decreased the Novalog 70/30 to 10 Units daily. Due to the headaches, tiredness, itching, muscle pain, runny itchy nose, I am now told to stop taking the Januvia and watch the blood sugars that I may need to increase the insulin again. The Insulin (Novalog 70/30) causes more weight in my middle. Also lab work today revealed decreased iron levels. Now have to take iron supplements.
Great med for Blood /sugar control. The only drawbacks are the incomplete bowel movements one experiences with this medication . All else works well !

Januvia work very wellin taking down my blood sugar, but it made me so sick I missed a lots of days out of work, because it gave me a Upper respiratory problem. It cause me to have bronchi. I still have the cough it keep me up at night and bother me during the day.

my mother is taking januvia and she has no energy, and her blood sugar has been far far too high, like in the 350 range and thats not right at all. all she has done is sleep because she has no energy, and no gumption to do anything, and on top of all that, she is so sick to her stomache that she isn't even hungry because nothing even tastes right.

After only two doses I had extreme muscle soreness and aches and could hardly get up and down. I also had swelling of face and hands,headache and a cough. I am not on any other meds. I tried metformin before this and could not take it either.
MY BLOOD SUGAR IS UNDER CONTROL, WHEREAS BEFORE I BEGIN TAKING JANUVIA IT WAS UNCONTROLLABLE DAILY.

Regularly taking this medicine,cure my nerves pains, type2 diabetes and Blood pressure.Side effects may be stiffness of joints specially in hand fingers at night while in sleep. Otherwise this is a wonderful drug, but expensive.

I've been using Januvia for 2 weeks. I have pain in my fingers and arms along with muscle pain in my legs. I'm also very constipated. I've read that others have had this problem - I will discontinue the use of this drug until i see my dr again.
i take januvia100 mg and actos 45 mg i find that my sugar lowers quite offten. i have never had a kidney function test, i feel ill i know something is wrong with me i just dont know what it is

I have taken Januvia for 4 weeks, my blood sugar has gone up since I started this drug. I also have leg pain that I have not had before. My muscle on one side is very hard and hurts when touched. I stopped this drug 3 days ago and pain has started to get better.
HAS NOT BEEN EFFECTIVE IN REDUCING BLOOD SUGAR
After taking januvia 100mg for 2 wks. I developed extreme itching and a bad rash. I went back to Actos.

This is awful! I have experienced sore joints hips/knees. I have gained 4lbs in 2 weeks. I have had a sore throat and sinus problems within the 2 weeks. I was told to stop taking it to see if I had noticed any difference and guess what? LOST the 4lbs and NO MORE joint pain and NO MORE SINUS problems! I have a follow up next month to see what other meds other then Januvia and Byetta would be helpful.

follow up to my previous post. I am the person that was doing the dash diet and excercise and tried to drop the januvia. After 5 days without januvia my physical symptoms were better. No knee pain, no muscle pain, i stop feeling physically bad. One bad thing though from going cold turkey on the januvia is that i started to get depressed and could not sleep. I felt like I had drug withdrawls. could not sleep at all, worse than when I was on the drug. I guess the body gets used to having the drug in the system and goes in shock without it. i finally broke down and took one quarter tab just to have it in the system and feel better mentally. Once i took a quarter pill i felt a little better in the head. It seems to work so I wonder if a step approach is required in order to not have the system go into shock. I guess after months on the drug the system changes and you cant just flip it back on the drop of a dime. i will talk to my endo and see what they think is the best approach to get rid of the pill. I will go back to lantus instead of this mess.

i started on only metformin only. My doc did not like the H1C reading and so he decided to have me try Januvia. I had the usual stomach problems and it was ok. I decided to kick into high gear my exercise routine to 2.5 miles in the treadmill and 5 miles at night on the bike. I started a modified DASH diet. After 12 weeks in Januvia i started experiencing weird symptoms that I had never experiece. I was diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes 6 years ago and was an lantus and step scale insulin. I was on lipitor on an off for six years and lisinopril. So i had never seen the weird symptoms before the Januvia. In the past 3 months i feel like i have been in a daze. Twice I went to emergency thinking I had heart problems. I would feel lathorgic during the day, i would get paranoid, had wild mood swings, elevated pulse, muscle pain, joint pain, problems sleeping, sensitivity to light and sound. It would get to the point that I could not be at a store that had bright lights because I would get dizzy and have vertigo. I decided to stop taking Januvia when I got pain in my left knee and started to have depression. My knee felt so bad that I had to quit my morning runs in the treadmill and the biking. Not good for someone who wants to loose weight. I started walking slowly again on the treadmill and then all of the sudden I pulled a calf muscle just from walking fast. I went to emergency thinking i tore a muscle, but it was only a pulled muscle. I stop taking januvia 3 days ago and have traded my morning run for a 5 to 6 mile bike ride and kept the evening bike ride also. My calf muscle is better know since I am off januvia but I am still having sleeping problems. The light sensitivity is gone also. No more halos on lights and the intensity of the light has disappear. I think i rather take lantus once a day instead of dealing with side effects. That helped me lose weight and was off all meds and insulin for two years until i started a job that required long hour
side effects: Muscle Pain, Joint Pain, Tachycardia, Fatigue, Insomnia, Dizziness, Vertigo, Depression
side effects cleaned: Body Pain, Tachycardia, Fatigue, Insomnia, Dizziness, Vertigo, Depression

drug_review: IT mad me sore in the legs and in my wrists and hands I took for a month and now been off of it for 3 weeks. i still hurt and been sucking down pain killers. I will never take this again.
i have had great luck with this med. mood swings were outta control before i started januvia, now i've leveled out good moods. some headaches and stomach issues but i expected that.

After taking Actos and Glyburide for many years and ballooning to 316 pounds, I switched to Januvia and lost 30 pounds in three months. Only problem was my blood sugar went out-of-sight, totally uncontrolled. Because my kidneys were starting to pay the price, I'm now on insulin. Very depressing.

I started taking in and it controlled my B/S i was in the 400's and it brought it down to near normal readings sometimes it got 2 low even in the middle of the night, i now keep peanut butter and crackers in my desk at work and oj in the fridge in case it drops to low again, i feel really good and am so happy that i have near normal readings my A1C went from a horrible 11 to a 7.0 i will continue to use it.

After taking 100mg pill once a day for five days I noticed increased muscle pain making it very difficult at times to stand and walk, slight dizzeness,slight headache, extremely tired, constipation, increased appetite for sweet sugaray foods. When I stopped takeing the medicine I got stomach cramps, a lot of gas, and the runs. This medicine is supposed to help? Oh I also take glyberide/metforim 2.5/500 3x day. I was given the junuvea because after two years glyberride/metforim allowed my A1c to climb from 6.9 to 7.8. With No change in diet.

Managed to get a Sprite and back to bed. I could barely walk. I thought stroke, but was hoping it was reaction to Januvia. I'm a female 69 years old and it scared me so much. I stopped taking it and will call my dr. Wonder if FDA is aware of these effects and should a recall be made?

drug_review: Works great for me.I also take glyberide and metformin.No side effects.This is a wonder drug for me.

My numbers were in the 200s and once went on it once a day in the morning and now my numbers are near normal. I do notice my readings are lower in the day then when I awake. No side effects. No weight gain or loss.

After only a day or 2 I experienced heart fluttering and stomach distress. Also nasal stuffiness and chest discomfort, probably due to the fluttering. I've also had some leg cramping and muscle tightness. My stomach seems jittery all the time. Glucose levels during the day were actually low, but high in the morning. My hemoglobin A1c came down from 7.5 to 7.1 in 3 months but I do not feel well on this drug and prefer to try to control my diabetes through diet and exercise. I even tried lowering it to 25 mg per day and have the same effects.

After 3 weeks, I almost ended up in the E.R. My intestine "plugged up" completely & I spent two entire nights in the bathroom trying to go & couldn't. Also terrible headaches, nausea, lighthedness, & waking up every two hours to eat. When I explained these symptoms to my doctor, he just said "Keep taking it; the symptoms will get better with time." He's not my doctor any more. I would not be a bit surprised to hear in the future that some people have died or been permanently injured due to Januvia. I stopped taking Januvia and all meds & I am getting better control of my BS with diet & exercise.
weight loss, more energy,lowered my blood sugar.

My Dr. prrescribed Januvia after taking me of of Actos - no weight gain but am unable to lose weight - also, blood sugar readings have not been as low as Actos and metformin - and recently have begun to climb - I am not entirely happy witht he effects of this medication but am afraid insulin may be the next step. Wish someone could tell me more about this...

The first week I felt great, second I noticed I was unable to sleep, after 1 month, my mouth and nose began to itch, I felt strange, dizzy, disoriented, I began vomiting and became very weak. I stopped taking it, but I did not get immediate relief. Its been 4 days and I have yet to become strong enough to feel safe driving. My monitor readings have escalated over the past month. I have gained 17 lbs.
I NOTICED A SEVERE DROP IN MY BLOOD SUGAR.

drug_review: I take Insulin with this & Amaryl. Has lowered A1C from 11.4 to 7.3 in 6 mths(not really following any diet) I have had a prescription for it for over a year, but I kept forgetting to take it. I am finally taking it regular the last 4 mths. I think it has started Ovulation in me again. I had only had 4 periods in 2008, but the last 3 mths have been regular but very heavy(can't really leave home for about 1 week). I have pain in my fingers, ankles & hips. Pain so bad at night I have trouble sleeping. My dr says its arthritis, but after reading all the comments that people have made, I'm beginning to wonder. I will continue to take it to see what happens.
I do not think this medication helped me at all

after approx 3 weeks I had a mini eye stroke which had to have come from use of the med becuasde I had blood work 3 weeks earlier and my blood work had changed and they indicated that strokes occur from high cholesterol and smoking of which I have never had and never smoked , excelewnt health except for the diabetes (mild) and jst dicovered that siode effects of Januvia is strokes and macular edema.

I had diabetes, type 2, for eight years. During this time I went from Glucotrol XL to insulin(110ml a day two shots, morning and night. I also take Avandia 5mg. My sugars always ran high 280s. No control. then my doctor said people have gotten great results with Januvia. I thought... we'll see! I have been on Januvia (100ml 1 a day mornings)for about 10 days and the results are astounding! I went from high 280s to 140s waking reading! I stopped the second shot and decreased the first significantly 35 ml due to hypoglycemia, so Insulin and Januvia are a very powerful combo. For the first time I am greatly optimistic that I can get off insulin with this wonder drug Januvia, and maybe one more bg lowering pill! No side effects yet! I'm feeling better overall because of the lower sugar levels, and control of this condition is now within reach! A change in diet(avoiding sugar)and more excercise(just walking) is doing wonders! I am actually looking forward to my next appointment, and getting off insulin! I love the way it works by helping your body make more insulin(for type 2s)and gets your liver to decrease sugar production making your body perform close to the way it should. It's a 1-2 punch that's doing the trick! Thanks Doc,WebMD and all of YOU reviewers for your comments and ideas! Your experiences are invaluable! That's why we read them! :)
been on it for a month. frist drug to get bs down to normal range. since being told 2yrs ago ttat had type2.no side efect yet

I was dizzy, chest colds, Very bad headache, Both hands were numb this was worse at night I would wake with my handshurting I still have some numbness it is off and on and and mostly in my fingers now. I was so hoping Januvia would work for me. I do not think this drug was not tested well enough before the public was allowed to use it. I hope my side effects are not long term and no damage was caused and with time will go away.

Blood glucose running consistent 80-99 all day; two hour BG running 115 to 140. Feel good and have lost weight with diet, exercise and the cocktail of meds above. Hope to get off meds by mid 2009.
I take it in the evening at meal time, and the blood sugar at wake up is 120-135. It is very expensive is there another less expensive medication.

I have been on Januvia for about 3 months now. I had very good results in reducing my post meal blood sugars for about 3weeks. Post meals averaged about 115-130. After that my post meal blood sugars have steadily risen to the range of 150-190. It also reduced my A1C somewhat from 8.0 to 7.5.
did not lower glucose significantly

I have been Type 2 since 2000. A week ago I was taking 1000 mg Metformin, 10-12 units of Lantus insulin and 5 mg Glucotrol XL. My A1C was at 6.3 which is good. My doctor had me drop the Glucotrol XL and start taking Januvia. I've always had problems with my 2 hour after meal readings. My first day of taking Januvia, my 2 hour reading after breakfast was 140! It has always been around 160-190. What a difference on the first day. If this continues, I hope to have real good control over my blood sugar readings.
I have just started this drug. What a relief. I am also on Insulin.

TAKING A 50MG ONCE A DAY, I WAS FEELING FINE. INCREASED TO 100MG AND HAD 2 MAJOR HEADACHES THAT LEAD ME TO THE EMERGENCY ROOM FOR PAIN TREATMENT. THE HEADACHE BROUGHT PAIN AND MY EYE SIGHT WAS BLURRED.

januvia controlls my diabetes very well

after starting Januvia my a1c levels jumped 2.5 to 3 points from prior readings so now my levels are in the 10.5 and 10.8 range. My bs readings went from the 200's to constantly over 400 sometimes off the meter. Developed acute abdominal pain, became lethargic, had breathing problems, GI tract problems, experienced chronic heart abnormalities and pain, night sweating, severe vision problems with double vision, and developed severe muscle pain, spasms and weakness. I stopped Januvia for 3 monthsand tried again and started to develop the same medical problems within 1 week and stopped again. I will never take the drug again. Woo hoo! No more debilitating diarrhea and stupor (glucophage & Metformin), no more excruciating pain, swelling and bloatedness (Actos), and no more blood sugar readings all over the chart! I am ecstatic and extremely pleased with Januvia! This drug is the first to successfully lower my blood sugar readings to within normal ranges after fasting and even after eating... and without any side effects!

I'm taking Amaryl and Gluphage for several years but my blood sugar was always 145+, docotr put me on Januvia, blood sugar went down to +-120 and my eye vision improved, but I started getting really severe headaches. They stopped after I discontinued Januvia.

This has been a godsend. Actos was driving me nuts. I gained about 25 pounds since on Actos. Since changing to Januvia I have lost 6 pounds in 3 weeks with NO change in my diet--either type of food or amounts. I have a consistant blood reading of around 160 every day. A little high but way better than being all over the map with Actos. I have had no adverse reactions like I did with Actos either.

I am a registered nurse and newly diagnosed Type II Diabetic (December of 2007). I have never been overweight, but have a family history of diabetes. I was put on Januvia 100mg every day in Dec. of last year, and it helped immediately even causing some very low blood sugars. Starting around March/April of this year, my readings started getting higher. I also have increased my exercise and have lost 22 lbs which is alot for my size (petite). This past month, my fasting blood sugars are almost always >200 and my random's are almost 300. I haven't had many readings <200 lately at all. My diet is not perfect, but I do follow closely counting carbs, using sugar free/low carb products, and limiting starches. It is very frustrating that I am spending the money on this "new" pill and doing all the things I'm supposed to do and it doesn't seem to be doing any good. I see my doctor tomorrow and do not plan to take anymore Januvia-will ask for glucophage/metformin. Also, I am scared of Januvia after researching online articles related to increased cancer incidence associated with Januvia use. Side effects I have experienced include: low energy levels, headaches, hip joint pain, & left ear pain. Hope to find something more effective.
side effects: Joint Pain, Headache, Ear Pain, Fatigue

drug_review: I was diganosised with type II in januray 2008, my a1c was 9.7. The doctor put me on Janumet 50/500 1 tab BID. I also took the diabetic class through out local hospital and learned not only about being diabetic, but how to change your eating habits to a more healthy diet. ALso exercise plays a big parts in the control...medication alone will not do it. I have lost almost 40 in 6 months. At my last doctors appointment the blood work showed that my a1c was doen to 5.0 my doctor as me "what the hell I was doing." He was very please with my results. If all continues on I will be taken off of my high blood pressure and cholerstrol medication. I have had no side effects at all which is really unusal as I am allergic to 9 different medications. My only drawback to this medication is the cost with it being a new medication the co-pay is high actually the highest tier with my insurance. The God my doctor can give me samples.

IT DIDN'T REALLY HELP WITH WEIGHT CONTROL AS MY DR PROMISED, BUT IT DOES CONTROL MY BLOOD SUGAR. WENT FROM UPPER 200'S TO AN ABSOLUTE HIGH OF 164! I AM ACTUALLY LOOKING FOWARD TO MY NEXT A1C! WHOODA THUNK IT ?
ABSOLUTELY NO SIDE EFFECTS...MAKES DIABETES FUN AGAIN!

I noticed a definite drop in glucose meter readings a short time after taking Januvia. It works for me, a Type II Diabetic.

Have taken 100 mg for a year. Even with an occasional cheat my BS levels are well within desired range, and my a1c is 6.4. Only side effect is mild constapation, which is cured with bran cereal. Clearly from other reviews this doesn't work for everyone, but for me it is a wonder drug. There are no crashes to worry about and no dangerous highs.

My husband, age 71, was prescribed Januvia, 100 mg/day,in Dec 2007 in addition to the glipizide and metformin he was already taking. It did lower his BS somewhatâ??he saw more readings under 100 mg/dl and fewer over 220. On the downside, as the weeks went by, he was feeling more and more lethargic; had less energy; felt cold all the time, especially at night; experienced severe nocturnal leg cramping; had persistent, severe constipation which led to his abdomen being hard and distended; and his blood pressure began creeping up. He also noticed a loss of taste and smell, also of balance and stability. In other words, he was feeling pretty crummy. He lasted on Januvia less than three months, from 21 Dec 2007 to 2 March 2008 when he stopped taking it. Within a day or two of stopping the Januvia he began to feel like a new person. Januvia being the only new addition to his meds, it was the prime suspect. Generally, he is feeling much better, most of his adverse reactions having subsided; however his BP and BS levels are still higher than before Januvia which have him concerned that Januvia might have changed something, hopefully not permanently. He now gets BS readings routinely in the high 200s, whereas pre-Januvia he would have to enjoy a dish of ice cream or a big meal out to get those readings. It is as if the glipizide and metformin are no longert effective and, despite cutting way back on carbs and increasing the exercising, he is finding getting back into control is more difficult than ever. Is Januvia going to be another drug rushed to market before adequate testing was done?
side effects: Fatigue, Weakness, Leg Pain, Constipation, High Blood Pressure
side effects cleaned: Fatigue, Weakness, Body Pain, Constipation, High Blood Pressure

drug_review: Am a registered nurse, not overweight (139) but with family hx of diabetes. Have taken Metformin 500mg daily since 2002. Random BS levels varied 90's to 150's, A1C varied between 6.7 and 7.0 but I'm not 100% diet compliant. Doctor started Januvia 100mg daily in addition to metformin to see if we could lower FBS and A1C. Instead, my BS levels have jumped from low 100's on metformin to nearly 300 by adding Januvia. I get a very strange "just not quite right" feeling and my energy level has plummeted. Until adequate testing proves the long-term effectiveness of this drug, I will NOT take it again.
No crashing and more energy.

Januvia (with metformin) has worked very well for me so far (3 months), with no adverse reactions. My doc wanted to take me off Starlix (w/metformin), which worked very well but did cause some very low blood glucose after meals. I resisted but finally agreed to try Januvia. Glad I did. Once a day. Almost no super low blood sugar. My A1C dropped from 6.3 to 5.8. My average glucose is about 105. A few highs, almost no lows. Morning glucose does seem to be a little higher than before. Weight stable. No changes in energy, muscle or joint pain. No one knows the long term issues, if any, but so far Januvia is working well.
