Iâ??ve been taking Jardiance for 4 months for my T2. Prior to starting on Jardiance I was using Afrezza m, the inhaled insulin only. So far Jardiance has not worked for me. When ever I eat anything my BG goes higher. 140-250. I am forced to continue to take what Afrezza I have left which reduces my BG back to normal in just 12 minutes. Supposedly it takes 24 weeks to Jardiance starts to work( says so in the pamphlet). Iâ??m going to keep taking it until I see my Endo again. Thank God for Afrezza. Itâ??s the best and my fight with my insurance company will continue until I win.

I have diabetics for more than 20 years, it is under control by Amaryl 3mg and Ozempic once a week. I have A1c 6.0 for last 2 years. I am taking Jardiance for not getting worse for my CKD 3b, also protect the heart. I was worried Jardiance will reduce my A1c more, during the last 4 weeks, I have 3 episode hypoglycemia. In order to know whether Jardiance will help my CKD or not, it will take 4 to 6 weeks. There is one point i would like to make. The documents said it will increase frequency of urination, but before i am taking Jardiance, i always get up at least 2 times at night, after taking one week of Jardiance, I only get up at most one time at night. At this time, I just reduce Amaryl to 2mg instead of taking 3 mg. I am 71 years old. So far no other side effect. Will post result in next 4 months.

My severe clinical depression coincides with taking three weeks of taking an increased dose of Jardiance. Iâ??ve never been this depressed for such a long period.(8 months) I believe it could be from the increase in Jardiance from 10 mg to 25 . Has anyone had a similar experience?
This medication now costs me $167 a month. I will ask my doctor to prescribe an alternative since I can no longer afford it.
my teeth are cracking, breaking and decaying. had 3 molars pulled and 2 more breaking apart. does anyone havean answer. Jardiance is the only new med.

I really can't tell if the drug has been effective. My main concern is with their asinine commercial showing a morbidly obese, (fat), lady dancing around as happy as a Lark! Her weight will bring a plethora of physical ailments later in life and probably an early demise!
Started Jardiance 3 weeks ago. Have horrible uti and have never had one in my whole 60 years! Feel lightheaded all the time! OFF IT NOW!
This medication needs to be taking off the market. If I had keep taking this junk I would not be hear today.

Jardiance made my life miserable. I had constant yeast infections and felt unwell for the two years I was on this med. It did little or no good at all. My diabetes was out of control and my A1c was a whopping 8.2 when the doctor changed this med. I was constantly watching what I ate and exercising; it did little or no good. Even my husband noticed a change for the better after I discontinued and went on an a more effective med.

I am male 60+years old with type 2 that has so far been held in check with insulin. I started Jardiance 3 months ago. Tried the lesser dose with little or no results. For the last month I have been on the 25 with much better results. At first I was rather disappointed in the results but the I did figure out the sugar substitute was using had a major impact on Jardiance. To clarify it was not the sugar substitute but the filler to make it measure like sugar. After I stopped using this filler enriched substitutes I was made a believer. My A1C is now 6.1 and I have actually lost 8 lbs.

Jardiance caused urinary infections. Five in three months. Then my prostate became enlarged, three times larger. Then I read a study that said everyone over 60 developed an enlarged prostate. This medication should be taken off the market!

I was taking Januvia and Metformin and glimperide and A12 was 7.8. Dr told me to take Jardiance 25 mg and stop Januvia. Yikes! My blood glucose went through the roof. It hit 250 and I donâ??t think it ever was that high. They have me on diuretic with Lisinopril but say to drink lots of water as Jardiance causes dehydration. Felt weak and out of breath. How will this Lowe A1C if blood sugar is so high. Iâ??m hungry all the time too. Jardiance is clever ads and is garbage. By the way I am NOT overweight either. Am stopping bad expensive drug.

HbA1c did go down; was up! Got Urinary tract infection that took more than 2 months to clear. Back on just metformin HbA1c is lower (may be due to stricter diet regimen following Jardiance discontinuation).

This med hit me like a freight train! About 5 hours after taking it I was experiencing, dizziness, fatigue, nausea, and later diarrhea. I called the doctor and was told not to take the second dose. It's now 24 hours and I am feeling washed out.

I was diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes recently. I am 25 years old morbidly obese woman, I weighed 139kgs (306.44lbs). I was prescribed with jardiance, my provider gave all the heads up. I must drink a lot of water since you will urinate sugar, must clean the private area with water not just tissue, avoid sugar at all cost! I limit my sugar intake at 26g a day or lower. 
 
 It's very difficult at first but you will get use to it. I weighed in on my 5th day of taking it and I lost 4.5kg (that's almost 10lbs!)
 
 Just follow the precautions in taking this medicine with diet and it will work! It will help you to lose weight too!

Ended up in the ER, I thought i was having a heart attack. As it turns out, I was dehydrated. Jardiance sucks all the liquid of you, I drink approx one gallon of water day. Stopped taking it and feel 100% better.
On the Metformin for 5 yrs and one day it eventually started creeping up my fasting to 12.0 . Jardiance after 2 10mg pills ?? I'm back down at 6.2 . Very satisfied .

A minor increase in my A1c, resulted in trying Jardiance. I experienced every side effect, after 42 days. I have suffered. I have been diagnosed with 2 additional conditions, as a direct result of taking Jardiance and am on insulin now, and was not before. This drug should be carefully considered by all.

Only started on Jardiamet 1 x 5mg/1000 a week ago. I am very sensitive to high doses of metforman, upset stomach and other side effects. I had My sugars under control for many years but all of a sudden they spiked quite dramatically. My doctor put me on the lowest dose and I am pleased to say that my blood sugars have come down. They were up as high as 14. My first test after taking it for 2 days was 7.4 the this afternoon it was 6.2 after lunch. I go to the toilet often but I also drink lotsof water. So far so good. For those who have had problems try a smaller dose. It worked for me

Used two days, immediately experienced excessive thirst followed by urinary problems of increased frequency, weakened urine flow and dribbling, pain during urination, low blood sugar, profuse sweating, one week later urinary symptoms are persisting, no infection detected, doctor said it could be weeks before things return to normal. Side effects could have been much worst (death) but, some people have are ok with it. Way to high incidence of bad reactions.

I am only 2 weeks in with 10mg of Jardiance. I had been diagnosed almost 20 years ago in my 40s and have been taking Metformin from the start along with Januvia added 5 years ago when my A1C went up to 7.6. Jardiance was added when my A1C got to 7.8.
 
 The first week was difficult, I had nausea and a rash on my arms. I found that 3 tumeric-ginger chewies or turmeric-ginger tea calm the nausea. 
 
 I don't have a new A1C to report but glucose is 20-25 points lower in the morning before food, soit looks very promising. Have also lost 1.7% of body weight due to eating less because of nausea.

Used 10 mg Jardiance for almost a year with no measurable impact on my morning (fasting) nor post meal blood glucose readings.
 
 I am going to toilet more often but the readings are not encouraging to continue using it despite I am on low carbohydrate diet. 
 
 This is my personnel experience.

I have been taking Jardiance for about a week and a half. It has a serious allergic reaction within my body: raised rash that feels like mosquito bites all over my body; the itching is extreme, major yeast infection, the palms of my hand and feet are red and tinder, not able to hold on to anything without major pain, stomach pain that is outragous, nausea, my skin hurts so bad and I know that I may have left out a few....had to use my Epi Pen and go to the ER. That medicine has been dumped.
After 2 weeks, uncontrollable bowel movement, dizzy, upset stomach, tired, rash, chest pain

I couldn't tolerate the side effects of Metformin (severe diahrea 5x a day) then was switched to Januvia which did nothing for me. Then switched to Glipizide which found myself getting the shakes (low blood sugar) at 2am reaching for a snicker to stabilize my sugar. Finally was switched to Jardiance within the first 6 months I suddenly got the most Severe burning, redness, hot itchy rash with swelling on my face on both of my cheeks, swelling in my right leg and pocket of swelling on my left arm! This rash was raised like hives and progresses with its characteristics following weeks of pain and discomfort. I Never experienced this rash in my 45 Years!! 2 Dermatologists, and my primary all misdiagnosed the rash as it was unexplainable! It wasn't until I did a process of elimination along with research the newest drug I was on (Jardiance) and its side effects that it made sense it was this medication with the SAME syptoms!!! First episode The rash lasted 2 months of burning, light swelling under my eye to cheekbone area, redness and pain. 2nd episode rash lasted 10 days. 3rd episode rash lasted 3 days yet comes and goes. Starts with a sudden flush of the cheek / or cheeks, then progresses to light swelling, then aggressively elevates to a reddish purplish color changes characteristics from raised hives to small blisters then smoothes out. The end result is a tightness burning feel in which I continued to moisturize. I exercise regularly and limit my intake yet my right leg and ankles still swell.

I have recently started taking 10 mg of Jardiance but had previously looked it up and was extremely concerned about the possible side effects. Having discussed my fears with my diabetic nurse she assured me that it is an excellent drug and said that, the only way to find out if it produced any side effects was to take it but to stop it if did. Fortunately, I took her advice and have had no side effects whatsoever so am now increasing the dose to 25mg and would recommend anyone else to take thesame course as the benefits could be huge.

So today is day 5 for me. 1st few days nothing but alot or urination which didn't seem unusual as I go because of high blood sugar. Today for the 1st time in I cannot remember my blood glucose was 100. Took blood glucose in am in high hundreds which normally was in high 200's. After breakfast was 120. Then my take before lunch was 80. Before dinner was again 100 after dinner was 170. Before bed was 115. I haven't seen these numbers years can't wait to see what A1c goes down too.
Been 9n jardiance for 8 months. My AIC went from 8.7 to 5.3. Been very pleased and no side effects so far.

I have been using jardiance since September of 2021 my A1c s the last three have been in the lower 5s and my weight on my 6 foot 1 frame was 333 lbs and I am currently weighing 221 my goal is set for 185 lbs . This has been life changing.

I took this in combination with metformin, glimiperide, actos and insulin. It had very little beneficial effect but a terrible yeast infection in my external urinary area. I was constantly treating with antifungals but it got so bad there was bleeding in addition to the pain. I discontinued use. Prior to using it, I had used Januvia with much less fungal infection. Don't know if it was my physical condition that caused the fungal issue or the difference in the drugs. But I cannot recommendthis drug.

After three years of taking Jardiance I developed Fournierâ??s Gangrene a life threatening skin condition. While having this reaction my blood glucose readings have been extremely erratic and my heart has been having palpitations. I was prescribed a strong course of antibiotics 4 times per day, and an antibiotic cream 2 times per day. Fourniers Gangrene has been the most uncomfortable and painful experiences I have ever been through. Will be seeing my dermatologist to see if skin debridement if dead skin cells will be necessary.

Before Jardiance I was on 2x500mg metformin and my glucose was 155 and A1C was 7.1. My doc prescribed jardiance. After reading many reviews, I am concerned about the side effect that it could damage the kidney as I have stage 2 kidney disease so I made sure that my kidney doctor gave me prescriptions of blood test for general kidney functions (called comprehensive metabolic panel ) every 2 week and for a comprehensive kidney functions test (comprehensive metabolic panel and other tests) every3 month.
 
 After 2 weeks of taking 6mg of jardiance, my fasting glucose dropped to 95 (no A1C test) from 155. A decrease in eGFR of 2 points and an increase in creatinine of ~0.1. eGFR and creatinine fluctuate from blood test to blood tests by more than these values so more blood tests are required to see if there is any bad effect on these two tests due to jardiance. 
 
 As for side effects, I have not notice there is any, except losing about 5-7 lb and urinate more often because I am drinking more water to flash out the sugar which bypasses the kidney. 
 
 The price for 30 pills of 10 or 25mg of jardiance in US is about $500-$600. I bought 30x25mg from a Canada online pharmacy for $120 and cut it into 4 pieces so it costs about a dollar a day. It would cost me more to use medicare prescription drug plan.
 
 I estimate that 1000mg of metformin is probably reducing my A1C by ~0.5. On the internet, there is a plot of glucose vs A1C and 33 points of glucose corresponds to ~1 point of A1C. 
  
 Thus if I drop the 1000mg of metformin and keep the 6mg of jardiance, my glucose would probably be ~115 and A1C be ~6.5.

I was placed on jardiance and found myself at the local ER fighting for my life. I was in active DKA and was placed in the ICU for 4 days. The ER doctor stated if I would not have came in when I did I would have been dead within hours.

I have had Diabetes Type II since age 55 when my sugar level moved over the range of 125. That's when they tell you that you are diabetic. Nothing changes, you just are now diabetic. I never had symptoms I just got the shakes if I had sweets for breakfast, then I would get hypoglycemic by noon. At age 65 I was running BS levels of 200 to 225 after meals and ended up on Jadiance along with 500 metformin twice a day. It worked well with no side effects at all. I lost 13 pounds the first month. Mysugar only went down to 150 so my pharnacist added Aloglipton and it fell further to 110 to 120. I am a VA patient and to cut down on pill cutting, I was switched to Jardiance 25/Metformin 1000 once a day after 2 months. I wil continue and see what happens.

Had been on Glimepiride 2mg daily for several years with excellent results. Daily fasting blood glucose levels were between 90-100. HgbA1c was 6.3. Have a history of coronary artery disease with a sextuple coronary artery bypass graft and a thalamic stroke. Took Jardiance 10mg daily for approximately 4 months and daily blood glucose levels increased to approximately 135 and my HgbA1c went to 7.1. Discontinued Jardiance and resumed Glimepiride. Daily blood glucose levels returned to previous levels and am anticipating HgbA1c back to pre-Jardiance levels.

Check with your doctor, but low dose twice a day may be a great option for those prescribed this medication! Using in lieu of insulin and for me at low dose, itâ??s working perfectly! Best sugar numbers in 4 years! You must drink a lot of water when taking this medication. Also diet and exercise, any exercise!
Finally stopped taking Jardiance because with Medicare and PPO the cost is prohibitive. Now I realize that Glimepiride does the job. Look how many thousands of dollars I could have saved.

I used to take 25 mg of Jardience about a year ago. I stopped because I had a terrible yeast infection that wouldn't go away. So I got Januvia and that med did nothing for my diabetes. So I had some Jardience left and took that again. This time I had no yeast and my numbers were in the targeted range of 4-7 and no side effects. I will keep using this med as it works well for me now. I also take 24 units of Tresiba insulin at night. I am feeling better and glad the Jardience is working well. I am trying to eat better and I do drink more water as well. If this keeps up, I will be fine and hopefully do well in the long run.

I stopped taking Jardiance because the side effects were brutal. I was dizzy, light headed and nauseous. In addition this medicine is very expensive. I have a three month supply which cost in excess of $300.00 and only took it for two weeks. Where do I get a refund. My name is Harold Stanton and my e-mail is - -[email protected]; telephone is 724 869 2777. I contacted my doctor but he has failed to respon.

After poor results with a weekly injection medication, my doctor selected Jardiance, and I could NOT be more delighted. I have lost weight, my blood sugar is more stable than it's been in ten years, and my general attitude is incredibly upbeat. Can't thank my doctor enough for this!

I had this for 3 weeks and the side effect hit me severe itchy, severe yeast infection, lightheaded and thirst and pee a lot. Jardiance really work for me is just the side effect. Doctor told me to stop taking Jardiance, Not sure what is the next Meds they will try me.
Took this drug for 8 days and ended up in bed for six weeks: extremely bad body itch, weakness, lethargy. Worst 6 weeks of my life.

anyone get lots of gas, gut "gurgiling" almost all the time? since I started on Jardiance 10 I have had these symptoms day and night. Also tired all the time. Has done nothing for fasting numbers as still in 140 to 170 range

I am 71 year old, I had already take medication for keep low the blood sugar, like Metformin 500mg two times a day and Januvia 1 pill a day, but the results wasn't so great, in the last times the doctor give me prescription for Jardiance well now after 60 year I have a results like 7.2 great product!

I was prescribed this by the VA about 2 months ago to use alongside Metformin and Glipizide. Lowered my blood sugar levels plus lost 4-5 pounds within s month. Only side effect is frequent urination. I am very happy with it.
Much lower insulin requirements and significant weight loss. Always thirsty on this medication and I drink about a gallon a day now. Very satisfied with the medication.

The first week I took Jardiance I experienced weakness and ached everywhere.(Flu like symptoms) I did go to the restroom frequently which was expected. Stopped Jardiance after the 1 week to see if symptoms would go away and they did. Decided to give it another try I had the same weakness and ached everywhere but worse the second time. Stopped the medication on a Saturday and by Sunday felt better except for my stomach hurting when i ate. A month later I am still having a few stomach issues but they are few and in between. I wouldn't recommend this medication. My blood sugar was higher each time that I took it.
Jardiance caused high ketones which was affecting my overall health and had to discontinue.

I was stable on Actos, but my P.A. was pressured to change me to Jardiance. Right away I started urinating more and my urine had so much sugar in it my slo-flow toilet kept growing fuzzy things. I lost 3-4 lb right away. By 3 months, I was hungry all the time, urinating at night, I lost 4 more lbs, my blood pressure rose and my A1c rose. I was using Flonase for allergies and developed nasal yeast (side effect of Flonase which never happened before) which has led to chronic sinusitis and obstructed airway sleep disorder and further hypertension. As soon as I stopped the Jardiance, all symptoms except for the sinusitis resolved. It took another year for the sinusitis to be discovered and another 6 months for surgery to open my sinuses. Now my respiratory issues are resolved, Actos is controlling my diabetes, but my blood pressure remains out of control. (Only been 2 months since the sinus surgery.) Jardiance is bad news and I get angry whenever I see the ads promoting it.

Started using 4 months ago, A1C 8.8. Just had blood work and my A1C is down to an amazing 5.5. I was already taking 850 mg Metformin twice a day and 10mg Glipizide XL. Only drawback has been mild yeast infection. I would recommend drinking plenty of water with this medication.

I am unable to tolerate Metformin so have been on insulin and Januvia in the past. My doctor switched me to insulin with Jardiance due to other medical issues. I have been able to lower my basal insulin dose drastically. My hard fought for, very slow weight loss has changed to pounds just falling off. I held on the starting dose due to vaginal discharge, ensuring that I would not be getting yeast infections prior to upping my dose. I did again experience a discharge with the higher dose but no infections and after a couple months on the new dose, it went away again without infections.

My Dr Changed me from Januvia to Jardiance 10 Mg for providing better Cardiac protection.Besides, this drug, I was also on Metformin 1000 twice a day. The overall A1C was around 7.0 and remained at this level with Jardiance. Instead of loosing weight, over 7 months, I gained about 8 Pounds. Morning Fasting levels were 130-140, with Januvia, they were 110-120.Side effects were, Excessive urination, Dry mouth and thirsty. I have asthma and with Jardiance, it was more difficult to control. In viewof all this, inspite of all the hype about this drug, I am stopping this drug and going back to Januvia. Very disappointing.

This medication has been a great addition to using insulin only. You have to make sure you drink water. A cup of coffee in the morning and not much else between doesn't cut it. Have to drink water. Yes, you're "peeing" out sugar, so you need to make sure you're drinking enough and keeping clean and dry down below to prevent urinary tract infections. If you don't put the effort in to using the medication properly don't expect it to work well for you. It's keeping my sugars between 70 and 110 depending on what I'm eating and I feel great. Can tell that my sugar levels are MUCH MORE STABLE.
Excellent medication for me! Just drink a lot of water, I did anyway!

My Dr thought I should try this RX, well ONE PILL almost killed me!!!I had trouble breathing,fainting,rapid heartbeat,horribly dizzy,almost fainted in the shower,stomach pain,made me feel like I was going to have a damn panic attack!! Get this crap off the market!!

I've been taking Jardience for almost 2 months and it has been great! My blood sugars have been between 70 and 100 depending on what I eat. I have cut down my carbs and drink plenty of water . Before I started taking this, my blood sugars were terrible and I struggled to get them down. I have to admit that at first I put off taking Jardience because I had read a lot of people's reviews saying how terrible this drug was, so I was scared of it. But, now I'm so glad I gave it a chance. It really works!!!

Dec.2019 until 2/9/2020 today after reading others comments IÃ¢??m done with Jardiance due to feeling horrible all over. Constipation, neuropathy, trouble sleeping, vaginal pain, I have it all! Ache so bad, no energy and I donÃ¢??t go anywhere now. Not hungry because I feel so bad. IÃ¢??m 72 and life has to get better for me. The side effects are really terrible and IÃ¢??ll see how I feel in a week. IÃ¢??m dieting low carb-no bread pasta or sweets. DonÃ¢??t like sugar free food. So IÃ¢??m going to seewhat happens now. Hoping to feel better and keep AIC under control with diet. I donÃ¢??t have an appetite for anything, IÃ¢??m just thirsty all the time and am drinking lots of water(4-6 oz.) daily. Wish me luck and send prayersÃ°??Â¢
Over a period of 5 years, I have been hospitalized with a Urinary Tract Infection. My doctor told me if I stay on it, I will likely have more! He took me off of this medication.

25 mg. dose. Very effective for about 12 hours after taking, then in the evening after dinner, doesn't seem very effective at all. Overnight and overall, appears no more effective in glucose control than 500 mg of Metformin ER. A1c 6.8 with Jardiance; 6.7-7.0 with Metformin ER. I have lost a few pounds and no yeast infections or other urinary issues. Cost is certainly an issue to me.
Average fbg dropped by 20-25 points. A1C went from 6.8 to 6.

Beware of Jardiance it is very hard on your kidneys. It made me urinate every 1 to 2 hours, even at night. I used this drug for a week and had to stop taking it Because I found Blood in my urine. Even before I saw the Blood on my underwear, I Did not like this drug. Jardiance caused me pain in my back, which was coming from my kidneys, I would not recommend this Jardiance. Please Be careful If you are taking this or thinking of taking Jardiance. This is the only drug I have ever had a major problem with. this is why I felt I had to write this warning. Be Careful
I took Jardiance 10mg for 4 months and my A1C went from 7.7 to 8. I also started losing my hair after 2 months. No issues with thyroid - it was tested.

Jardiance helped me loose 25 lbs. I didn't have any side effects at all. I have Kaiser insurance and was only paying $45/month.They have now denied the medication after being on it for 1-1/2 yrs. I am very angry as this because my experience was awesome. I'm still fighting it.

I got enrolled in the savings program and it would cost me $77.00 every month, cant afford that and it is with the savings card too!! So I actually never got started on it, physician prescribed something else.

This is best treatment for me due to my issues with swelling/edema. I can walk so much easier and not get winded so much. Plus the strain of all the fluid was a factor in my frequent migraines. Since starting this medication - no migraines!!!

Took Jardiance for 4 months. Did not lower my A1c at all, but my fasting bloodsugars were great! I could not tolerate the side effects though. I had chronic brain fog, could not think ckesrly at all ever. I had vey bad recurring yeast infections that would come back as soon as i would finish treatments with Monistat and diflucan. And a very bad UTI that is taking a long time to clear, even after stopping Jardiance. Also starting this month my insurance required using other meds before theywould pay for Jardiance. So, Either way I HAD to get off.

Within 3 days I had a RAGING yeast infection so much so I was bleeding. I googled the drug, figured it might be the drug, and it totally was. 3 days after stopping medication, I was yeast infection free. Why do drug producers do this to us???

extensive side effects took2 months then stopped as made me feel terrible . Side effects inluded frequent and urgent peeing. Constant nause. Weak leg muscles. No appetite. Weight loss 11 pounds in 2 months(i was not overweight) . Higher morning glucose results
A1C has dropped from 6.9 to 5.3. It seems to help me lose weight by excreting glucose in urine. no bad effects.

Be very aware of the side effects. After 3 days I ended up in the hospital via ambulance in ICU. Never would have thought this drug would almost kill me. So be very careful and don't ignore side effects.

Started taking Jardiance on July 16th. My A1C was at 8.0. Eating junk most days, no exercise. I started a daily fast walk of about 2.5 miles, started eating better, and with the help of Jardiance, the pounds starting flying off. I've lost 25 pounds since then, and my A1C is down to 5.5. Couldn't recommend this more!

I started using Jardiance July 1, 2018 in addition to Glimeperide and Metformin ER. My A1C has been between 7.2 and 7.7 for the last 3 years. The goal was to get it down below 7. My A1C this week is 6.4 down from 7.2 in June. I have had no side effects and highly recommend this drug.

I started of using 10mg of jardiance which had little effect on my sugars, but did drop my A1C from 7.8 to 7.2 in 3 months. I did ask Dr. to increase the dosage to 25mg due to my sugars where still ranging over 250. after 3 weeks, my sugars have basically leveled out. The highest I have had was a 177. Cannot wait to see what my A1C looks next time I'm at the Dr. office. Future looking good at this point.

I was glad when I took up this option as I really didn't want to take up injections. It has definitely brought down my A1C but the side effects and overhead is overwhelming. Constantly drinking water(80-100 floz) to avoid yeast infections or UTI and still got affected. Eating portioned sizes to avoid ketones in blood stream. Joint pains moving from one joint to another.

My doctor prescribed this for me in March. My A1C is lower than it's been in years and I've lost 20 lbs in 4 months. No signs of any UTI. But, I drink more than a gallon of water a day. I've always drank a lot of water.

WOW I really did think that this was a diabetic dream come true. Until one week after taking the medication I developed an yeast infection. I was prescribed fluconozole and it went away. Only to be replaced by having my vagina becoming very sensitive and uncomfortable. I later noticed that the inside and surrounding area was starting to swell. I have stopped the medication and slowly getting back to normal. I had lost 5 pounds in 2 weeks and my blood stick was never over 150. I will so miss it.
Started on this drug one week ago. Was ok at first, a bit thirsty and frequent urinating. Within one week developed yeast infection. Burning sensation and very uncomfortable. Not for me.

Love this medication. I was taking it for 2 yrs, lost 8 lbs and my A1C went from 10.0 to 5.9. However, my insurance company refuses to pay for this wonder drug. Can't believe they can dictate our health. Now I have to go on Farxiga and if that doesn't work Invokana. I don't even know if I'm going to bother.
I lost a hundred pounds using this drug in two years. That and once a week trulicity

Got my A1C down quick, insurance forced a change to Invokana. Didn't work, bad side effects. Then they made me try Farxiga, didn't work, bad side effects. Back on Jardiance 2 days and BG down into target and I feel soooo much better!
6 Months ago I started Jardiance with a A1C of 12.9, after 3 months it went to 9.2, 3 months later I'm at 7.5. Off one shot of insulin.Oh and I feel great!
Hi, I too had awful yeast infections, even after I stopped taking Jardiance. It did not lower my A1c, plus my right kidney was in allot of pain, until I stopped this medication. It is not for me.
One yeast infection in the beginning of use. Otherwise, it has worked well. Still waiting on A1c results and I lost a couple of pounds. Hope the generic works as well.

I took Jardiance for almost a year - while it lowered my A1C about 2 points and I lost some weight - the UTI's and yeast infections were just non stop. My insurance has just discontinued Jardiance and is now switching me to Farxiga - I am a bit leery after reading the reviews - might be getting into the same situation with it - but I am hopeful it works without those same side effects. If it weren't for the UTIs and Yeast infections it would be a great medicine.
Caused an itchy painful rash on penis
While this medication helped me shed some weight, it gave me horrible, the most annoying and brutal yeast infections! I am going off this medication. So not worth having yeast infections

This drug was horrible for me. It caused urgent diarrhea. I started taking half the recommended dosage and that symptom was replaced by brutal yeast infections. Despite treatment for the yeast infections which persisted I told my Dr. I would no longer take it. My Dr. recommended Victozia which is working for me now. I'll never go back on Jardiance.

lowered my BG from 8.5 to 5.6 in 3 months, loss 40lbs, blood pressure went down cholesterol went way down also I used it along with diet and exercise. I have been able to drop two of the meds I was taking for blood pressure

I have been taking Jardiance for just over a year - I have NOT experienced any side effects whatsoever - MORE importantly this drug has reduced my blood sugar levels to an average of 5 and has maintained this level quite incredible nothing else has worked previously - I have named Jardiance as the "diabetic wonder drug" although my Doctor keeps reminding me there is no such thing as a wonder drug - I disagree this is MY wonder drug - thank you Jardiance you have changed my life completely astonishing result.

Type 2 Dia for past 12yrs. Been on Jardiance for 1yr now. Best results I've had of the many drugs prescribed. I poorly control my eating and do little physical activity. Always been a "Big Guy" 6'1 previously 300lb , I've lost 40lbs since beginning Jardiance. My eyesight has greatly improved and my numbers are getting back to acceptable levels. Negatives: with my insurance price is still $1 per pill, urination increased but is not as bad as other describe. Seem to grave Milk (1 gallon/day)???

I use to suffer from general fatigue but after starting this medication, fatigue is gone. There is a lot of urination but I'm okay with that. I've lost weight without trying and can't wait to see what my A1C results are. I really like this over metformin. Metformin was not as effective. This is great for me.

I am a 49 y/o woman. A1C of 7.0 and already on Metformin 1000mg twice daily. Jardiance prescribed and not only did it NOT help lower my glucose, I have gotten my 2nd yeast infection in the 3 1/2 weeks that I have been on it. Too bad too, because, as promised by my doctor, I have lost 15lbs, without trying. It does make you thirsty and pee a lot, but I have always been ONLY a water drinker.
This drug has fewer side effects than others I have tried. It has controlled my blood sugar effectively and I can't wait until I get my bloodwork done to see if it has lowered my A1C as well.

This has helped me so much. I have back issues and have had to take cortisone for the pain. My diabetes was up the roof. I was put on this plus metaformin. This has been a blessing. My A1C is 6.7 from a 10.1 and along with excercise and eating portions I've gone from a size 12 to a size 7. Yes a lot of urinating but drinking water does that too.

This medication seems to provoke labored Breathing, Pneumonia type symptoms, and a hacking cough. This is the second go around as the first time I went to urgent care, they did testing found nothing and put me on an Antibiotic and later prednisone. after six weeks it cleared up and I tried it again, with the same symptoms which started approximately 1/2 hour after the dose. It also seems to cause Blurred vision within 1 hour after the dose. After any meal it seems to cause sluggishness, dizziness, and some chest discomfort. For all the bad symptoms it is not worth the degree in which it works. A 10 mg/Dl drop when the Bg is over 300 just is not worth not being able to move.

urination at night 2/3 times abdominal pain frequent diahrrea but found the joint pain overwhelming slowed me way down,, YEAST , YES YEAST penis area near invocanna, then farxinga to jardience because had to try the old version first insurance issues all had very similar expecially yaest and dyhydration jave me worst cholestral bad levels i have ever had

although I felt very thirsty and dry mouth the first few days I went to pharmacist and they got me over the counter losanges to help keep mouth wet ..my blood sugar is down finally and feeling great ..you do pee a lot more but ..trade off is good
Following chemo treatments for cancer my diabetes was pretty much out of control. My doctor recommended that I try Jardiance to get it back under control. I've been very happy with the results

I was stuck in the low 7s for A1c readings over a year. Jardiance has lowered my fasting to a consistent 120 and afternoons / evenings to 100 range. This is just the first two weeks though. For those concerned about drinking / urinating, I'll just say if it helps prevent kidney stones (you DO NOT want a kidney stone) by increasing your water intake, etc., than that's just another added bonus.

I was on Metformin 2000 daily..BS was around 130 fasting...I used this drug for 2 weeks and had to stop. It made me urinate every hour night or day and awoke me in sleep every hour. I drank excessive water and had urges to add salt a whole lot to my diet. My urine was always pale or clear and not natural. My urinary track seemed irritated most of the time. This drug as a stand alone did nothing more than Metformin...

I've been on Metformin & Glimepiride for 8 1/2 years. My A1c had been in the low 6's until about 2 years ago when it got to the low 7's. Nothing helped - even Levemer. My doctor added Jardiance to my scripts in Feb. Just got my 1st quarterly blood work. My A1c went from 7.2 to 6.5! My bg rarely goes over 135 unless I eat something that I shouldn't. Sometimes I go for days without going over 100. Expect my next A1c to be in the low 6's. No side effects at all.

My A1C has gone from 7.4 to 6.9 while using this drug in just six weeks. In addition, I have dropped about 8 pounds without trying and I am not obese. My doctor believes that the drug may continue to bring down my A1C even further.
I have been on this for two weeks and my blood sugar has lowered to the lower 100's from 300. I do find myself drinking more and urinating more. That would be the only side effect.
After 8 weeks, I seem to need less attention to what I eat (within reason) and more attention to when I eat.
I think in combination with Glyburide/Metformin it works and lowered my sugar level from 270 down to 170 this morning

ok so far
it works fine but insurance co. won't cover so now have to use tradjenta good luck everyone.

I have been on Onglyza for 2 weeks.....I have Dawn Phenomen Diabetes, meaning my surgar goes up during the night when I sleep and during the day decreases. My morning readings decreased by 20 pts. A possible side effect that I need to get information on is that I am feeling DEPRESSED AND ANXIOUS. I am lethargic and lack ambition. I take Onglyza in the morning. Today I stopped Onglyza because I want energy without anxiety and depression which is a horrible feeling...I am beginning to feel 'numb'...I am on no other medication...I cannot contact Onglyza by phone which is a great disappointment.
People's bodies work diffrently with this drug but If you feel any sever side effects like I did with Onglyza do not wait and call your Doctor right way.

I have high sugar readings in the morning and taking Onglyza greatly improved my levels in the morning and during the day. I also take Amaryl in the morning and after dinner. The pain was so bad that I could not sleep and there was nothing to help alleviate the pain. I thought that maybe, I had sciatica or some form of arthritis. I was also on Crestor and I thought that my leg cramps might be caused by that medication. I stopped the Crestor and the pains got worse. I got to the point that I was crying. I finally decided that I must come off of this horrible medication and without doctor's orders, I did. After about two days, my pain has improved and I can finally I can finally walk and function again. I will have to notify my doctor of my action and I will never take this medication again. This medication is really bad for me. The side effects that it has caused to me are terrible! It should be ilegal to sell a medication like this.

If you take Coumadin or another blood thinner you should never take Onglyza. It has a dramatically adverse effect on your Coumadin levels and the Coumadin seems to destroy any positive effect the Onglyza has on blood sugar levels. After a month on Onglyza, with no other changes in diet or medication, my Coumadin levels were at historic lows. 2 weeks after stopping Onglyza the Coumadin level was back to normal and blood sugar was improved

i have been on this medication for about 2 weeks now and it seems to be helping lower my blood sugars the only thing it is very costly and i don't think i can afford to but it other than that it is great

Alert: Acute Lymphocyctic Leukemia - developed within 2 months after adding Onglyza to Meformin. (chance of ALL development in age group - 1 in 100,000). May 16, 2010 - Subject 55 yr old, healthy type 2 DM - Blood work WNL, Platelets of 258,000, Lymphs 25 %. May 26, 2010 - Onglyza added to Metformin. As of July 22, 2010 - Platlets: 36,000, Lymphs: 49%. Development of ACute Lymphocytic Leukemia (ALL). Suggest cautiona and close monitoring of CBC when adding Onglyza to Metformin.Per Bristol MeyersSquibb - in phase 3 study when Onglyza was added to Metformin - patient developed a " lymphoprolferative disorder" - type not specfied. The devlopment of Acute Lymphocytic Leukemia in 55 yr old type 2 DM (duration of DM x 2 years) reported to FDA Medwatch and reported to Bristol Meyer Squibb. Effect of Onlglyza on Lymph system not well described in prescribing information. Per Bristo Meyers Squibb - there was a dose -related mean decrease in lymphocyte count observed with Onglyza. Suggested lymhocyte count should be measured in setting of ususal or prolonged infection. More recent prescribing guidelines appear minimal and do not address changes in lymphs. Please research, review and monitor patients closely. Any acute leukemia development after adding Onglyza to Metformin? Any changes in Platelets/Lymps/CBC?P

I am very, very happy that so far, I am able to control my bg much better. I'm only one 100 mgm before breakfast. So far, so good!

I HAVE BEEN TAKING INVOKANA 100MG FOR ABOUT 17 MONTHS AND IT HAS WORKED GREAT. I LOST 25LBS AND MY WEIGHT IS STILL ON TRACT.MY AC1 WAS 11.2 NOW IT'S 6.9. I see a lot of comments about adverse effects of frequent urination, loose bowels, yeast infections, excessive thirst...This medication enables your kidneys to filter out the glucose in your system. This is not a normal kidney function. This medication is meant to aid you not do all the work for you. You are thirsty and pee a lot because your kidneys are working overtime to release the glucose. Yeast infections occur due to peeing out the glucose. I've been taking invokana for 6 months, I use cranberry vitamin and have never had a yeast or bladder infection. I only get loose stools if I hate something I shouldn't such as grease, excessive sugar or fatty meals. Eating a healthy diet and incorporating exercise in has eliminated all side effects, I still pee a lot and drink as much as I can, this medication will over work your kidneys thus leading to dehydration. Drink plenty of water and you will be fine. Eat better, exercise, don't use it as a band-aid while continuing unhealthy habits. Of course results will be different for everyone but I assure you, following these simple steps will help you achieve your goals. Stay Strong!!
This medication has worked wonders for me. I have been on the medicine for about 1 month and My HA1C came down from a 12.4 to a 7.9!!!!!! To God be the glory with chanbge of eating and exercise.

I have been a diabetic for over 10 years and have never been able to lower my A1C. My numbers increased from the start until my PCP put me on Invokana. My last reading before being put on this medication was past 8.0. I have been on it for almost 6 months and my A1C has dropped to 6.6. This is the first time my A1C ever went down. I do have to urninate more than before but if my A1C is finally getting under control I don't mind.
I have been taking Invokana for 1 1/2 years now I have lost 50lbs,although I make 4 to 5 trips a night to the bathroom, I am completely happy with the results of my A1C

Have been taking for 3 weeks. Have noticed decrease in BS at various times througout the day. Missed one day and noticed elevated blood sugar. Side effects are increased urination and subsequent thirst. Causes you to drink more water which is good for you anyway. Lost about 4 pounds.

I took 100mg 2x a day for almost 2 weeks and did not have a blood sugar reading under 200. I then went up to 300mg 2x a day and my blood sugar readings got worse. I drank fluids like there was no tomorrow and went to the bathroom constantly. I would get so light headed in the mornings that I could hardly function. My doctor can't believe that I had so many issues because all his other patients are doing great on it but I would not recommend this drug to anyone. I was miserable.

I lost 13 lbs. Only side effect is increased urination which will go down over time. I have less yeast infections as well. I am very pleased with this drug so far.

Been on for almost a year - A1c has went from 11.4 to 7.8. First time a medicine has helped. I have occasionally have to do a bathroom run in the middle of the night, but otherwise no side affects. 300mg dosage.

It worked well the first three months I was on it but starting this last month I started emitting gross looking mucous from my bowels. Then ended up super constipated and I was cleaned out I started having more gross mucous ranging from white to light brown to completely bloody. Have been to emerg 4 times where doctors have done numerous blood tests, abdominal xrays, etc. All results have come back negative so the doctors only conclusion is that it has been caused by the Invokana. I have now been completely off of it for nine days but am still experiencing the mucous evacuation, low grade fever which leaves me soaked by morning, etc. I DO NOT RECOMMEND anyone to take this experimental drug which was given me by my diabetic Nurse Practitioner. My life has been a living hell this last month and hopefully once this drug is out of my system I will have no further reprocusions from it.
This med made my stomach upset. Was going to the bathroom a lot at night. At least 3 to 4 times. I did loose about 5lbs. Terrible yeast infections. A1c did go up. on it for only 3 months

my BS went from 180 [fasting] to 110 average, so it works, but expect to get up three times a night to urinate and the cost is a BIG factor if you have no insurance it costs $414.00 for 30 pills, (one per day)b ut they definitely work, (I got off after two months)

I have been on Invokana for 3 months. Initially I had recurrent low blood sugars. Currently, I experience low blood sugars in the morning after taking it but then throughout the day my sugars become high after trying to raise them to a safe level. Beware you will lose bladder control with this medication to the point that you will pee in your pants. Also makes you very thirsty. I took it for a few weeks and will not take it again.

A1C dropped from 9.5 to 6.6 in less than two months. As a result I'm no longer taking insulin. It did lower my blood pressure, so I was able to get off BP meds as well. I'm very pleased with how it's working for me!

The FDA has issued a warning. But my wife wasn't warned and it isn't listed as a side effect. However using this drug can lead to diabetic ketoacidosis which is suppose to be rare in type 2 diabetics. Please be aware of the symptoms and seek medical attention of you have any of the side effects. Talk with your doctor about this FDA warning and please take it seriously. My wife spent 4 days in the ICU along with another patient also on Invokana.

I have been taking this med for 4 months. In that time my A1c has dropped from 9.3 to 7.3! I also lost 5 pounds. I haven't had any yeast infections but I've never been prone to them. Maybe eating yogurt nearly every day helps this. Only side effects are frequent large voids, slight hypotension when I stand, and having to get up twice a night to urinate. I'm willing to put up with this for the obvious benefits.

I have been using this medication for 6 months. It worked well in helping to reduce my AIC, but I just hate the vaginal bacterial infections. I read that after 6 months of using the medication the infections will subside. I still get them. I do take a pro-biotic tablet, but it's not that strong. I will try taking some of the expensive Ultimate Flora Women's Complete 90 Billion pro-biotic tablets that I read about on this site. Hopefully they will help eliminate the bacterial infections. Drink plenty of water because you can experience dehydration really fast. I have noticed that my weight stays down with this medication. I take the Invokana 300mg and Humalog + Lantus.

I am always scared when I take any new meds, after I took Invokana, I felt the change in my body, I was a little fatigued for a week, but got adjusted to it. After a month and a half of taking it, my daily clucose readings are lower and I lost over 11 pounds and I never felt better. I like this medication a lot, it has drastically changed my life.

I had the typical yeast infection at the 100 mg dosage. When I went to the 300 mg dosage, I began to have terribly servere and painful leg and foot cramps almost immediately every single night. I did not have uninterrupted sleep for the entire time I took this drug. I think it is very dangerous, causing severe dehydration which, even after 3 weeks off the drug, I continue to experience. And I drank a ton of water.

I highly suggest avoiding this medication if you possibly can. I was hospitalized for a week due to a poor reaction to this medication. I met numerous doctors as I was the first person in my general area of the country to have had the reaction. Thankfully I'm young so I managed to survive. I was told had I been 50 or more, I would've died. I had a severe amount of acidity in my blood, was acute ketoacidosis and I was in diabetic shock. Took Invokana for a month in a half approx. by the time it happened. There was no other causes of my ketoacidosis. It did help lower my sugar though. And normally I don't have negative reactions to medication. If you really need to take Invokana, I highly suggest purchasing ketone test strips at your local pharmacy and keep an eye on your keytone levels in your urine to hopefully catch ketoacidosis before it hits. If that's even remotely possible. But if you can take anything else, I would suggest doing so. And I'm not one to spread around fear in others. It is really a genuine warning. Please be careful when taking this medication, especially if you have other health conditions or are older in age. I almost died as it was and I'm 29 years old. But hey, if you've been taking it for a while, it works and nothing happened.. then great! Doesn't mean ketoacidosis will happen to everyone. But it can. As to why I'm posting my review. Take care everyone.

My a1c was 9.9 now its 7.0. Wonderful drug! I am up at night urinating but thats a small price to pay for good blood sugar. Metformin gave me shortness of breath and chest pains. I also take glipizide for my sugar. I am very happy with this med.

Create a Google alert to make sure you don't miss any new info about its side effects. The FDA has issued a warning and Health Canada is investigating it.

good my A1c went to 6.2 blood sugar in good range i am concerned and confused by all the negative info coming out now new FDA warning would appreciate more reliable info about this drug i am on metformin also
using it for 5 weeks in conjunction with metformin and januvia, blood sugar is down 60-100 points!

I will stay on this as long as my Dr tells me to. :)

Invokana 100 mg for 1 month, 200 mg for 2 months. A1C used to range from 7.4 to 8.4...after 3 months A1c was 9.0! Lost 7 pounds (1 gallon of water is approx. 7 lbs) had 1 yeast infection...been on 300 mg for 3 months and am crossing my fingers for my blood test next month.

I have tried everything to help my Diabetes of 24 years. Only this one, accompanied by Metformin, has worked! 30 days on 100 mg and now 30 days into my 300 mg. I feel reborn! I LOVE this medication! I have lost weight, my A1C has dropped a lot and I only have a minor yeast infection which hardly bothers me at all. I am not urinating any more than I was before but I am feeling constipated. I took 100mg dose for approx. 3 months.
